programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples in Plymouth battle to be the best dinner-party hosts and win a £1,000 prize. The pairings taking part are Steve and Caroline, who hope to impress with their complex Middle-Eastern menu, newlyweds Jade and Seb, who must try hard to keep their guests happy, and foodies Bev and Nick.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Nikolas Patrick Pawnbrokers in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick consider a £30,000 designer dress and a pair of unusual clocks. Nathan examines a retro jukebox in London.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At London Road Pawnbrokers in Sheffield, owner Dan and mum Lena are trying to seal the deal on some inflatable water-walking balls and a large collection of gold.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer revisits two couples he helped look for their perfect properties. Rebecca and Joe from Warwickshire needed a family home with space for their three racing camels, and did not want to move too far from their friends and good schools. In Essex, Steve and Dee had £1million to spend, but a long list of requirements, including a swimming pool and a squirrel-shaped hedge.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of first-time buyers searching for properties in south London. Niki and Rob have £450,000 and want a home with enough space to allow them to start a family in the future, while Georgie and Louis have been commuting from Surrey for years and feel the time is right to move to the capital. But what will they find with a £220,000 budget?.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to Forest Garden Shovelstrode in East Sussex, where hosts Charles and Lisa Hooper hope the guests buy into their woodland retreat.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fun-loving Sonya Smith is the first to host the dinner-party challenge from Reading, Berkshire, and aims to win over the guests with a Touch of Sparkle theme. Aware her cooking skills leave a lot to be desired, she hopes to bungle her way through the night, and though she is amused by the kitchen chaos, not everyone is impressed.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Londoner Glen Wilkie hosts the second dinner party of the week in Reading, Berkshire, and is confident of victory. However, a disaster with his dessert gets the day off to a bad start, and his main course, which he has chosen to call Bambi on a Plate, leaves one guest in tears - while another flatly refuses to eat it.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mature student Richard Howse hosts the third dinner party in Reading, using a menu and set of instructions provided by his girlfriend to guide him. A treasure hunt brings out Glen Wilkie's feelings about Serine Daou, Sonya Smith dislikes some of the gluten-free food and, for the third night in a row, Sabi Phagura is served a plate of meat she will not eat.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth dinner party in Reading sees fitness fanatic Sabi Phagura putting her healthy regimen to one side to host a bhangra-themed evening. Unfortunately, neither the traditional Indian food on the table nor the entertainment seems to impress the guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Corset-maker Serine Daou hosts the final night of the culinary competition in Reading, Berkshire, and hopes to impress with her burlesque-themed party. When the gourmet burgers she serves fail to impress, she must rely on the evening's entertainment to put her back on course for the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay continues his travels across America saving failing restaurants from disaster. In the first of two visits to Mill Street Bistro in Norwalk, Ohio, the chef encounters Joe Nagy, who claims he has the best menu from New York to Los Angeles. However, his servers and diners tell a different story, and his resistance to change leads to some explosive confrontations.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Scottsdale, Arizona, where he meets husband-and-wife bistro owners Samy and Amy Bouzaglo, who reveal a shocking contempt for customer feedback. The chef faces the biggest challenge of the series to save Amy's Baking Company, but can he get through to this defiant pair?.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: Mr Parsons the chameleon meets a new partner, Daphne from Paris. Jaguars Napo and Goshi are being encouraged to mate, but Napo doesn't seem to be romantically inclined. Meanwhile, young giraffe Murchison faces the great outdoors for the first time, and another baby elephant is born, less than a month after the last new arrival.(n)

programme.title: A Very British Hotel
programme.desc: London's Mandarin Oriental Hyde Park host a flamboyant wedding ceremony, VIP guests including Morgan Freeman and Quincy Jones check in, and veteran concierge Francois-Xavier is asked to source a watch worth more than a quarter of a million pounds for one wealthy guest. Born-and-bred Londoner Paul starts work at the hotel, and must learn fast what it takes to be at the top of the five-star game, while Vanya is missing her boyfriend after eight months of working nights.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Archaeologist Sophie hopes Second World War enthusiast Mark will be the man for her. Also entering the romantic restaurant is comedian Kelly, who worries that she tends to intimidate men. Can high-flying entrepreneur Russell handle her banter? Plus, mum-of-four Heather, 72, hopes retired businessman Gary will keep her company in her twilight years.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Astronaut-in-training Nicky hopes to find romance with well-travelled motoring journalist Daniel. The restaurant also welcomes road sweeper Bruce, whose date is mother of two Yvonne. After years of being single, she's ready to put herself first and to find that one true love to keep her company into her twilight years.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Cameras follow Jody and Chris, who struggled with infertility, and are now awaiting the arrival of their first child at Liverpool Women's Hospital. There's also a look at expectant Mormon couple Cameron and Hannah, and Lesley, a single mum-to-be who plans on raising her baby alone.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Liverpool Women's Hospital faces a bed crisis, so shift leader Sarah and the midwives have to juggle and prioritise to ensure everyone gets the care they need. Among those facing a wait is 34-year-old home care assistant Kristina, whose twins need to be delivered as quickly as possible and will need special attention.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to Nashville, Tennessee, the spiritual home of country music, but his visit begins on a sour note at Chappy's Cajun restaurant. Chef John Chapman's careless methods have damaged his reputation, but he blames the local clientele rather than his less-than-appetising food and disturbing kitchen practices. Can Gordon get through to this stubborn owner and save the eatery from disaster?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads to the coastal community of Long Beach, California, to save an Italian restaurant that was opened in 1958 and now under the misguided leadership of Nino, who blamed by brother Michael and sister Carina for the eatery's failings. Their 78-year-old mother Inge desperate for Nino to turn the business around, but the feuding family members will have to solve their differences first.(n)

programme.title: Loaded
programme.desc: The friends are proudly looking forward to launching their long-awaited new game at the big expo, but Watto has other ideas and takes drastic action to save them from the corrosive influence of their wealth. When Leon, Josh and Ewan find out what he has done they're forced to take extreme measures of their own, while Casey goes on the rampage and unleashes the full force of her fury on Leon.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Doctors treat a young woman who has been thrown from a horse, which then trampled on her, and also a woman who was hit by a car while riding her motorbike on a dual carriageway. Plus, an 11-year-old boy is brought into hospital after running into a wall at school and hurting his wrist.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: Anna Richardson and Andi Osho investigate just how British some iconic Brit products really are, and whether retailer B&M lives up to its `Big Brands, Big Savings' promise. Plus, the swimwear that promises to help shoppers look `10 pounds lighter in 10 seconds'. Should consumers pay for expensive brands or will high street versions do the same slimming trick?.(n)

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three pairs of partners from Berkshire compete to win the £1,000 prize, including Leanne and Ricci who hope to impress their guests with a Caribbean-inspired menu. Also competing are cultured couple Eveleen and Michael, before final duo Natasha and Paul throw an evening dedicated to fine dining and quality ingredients.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: A guitar signed by David Bowie turns up in Sheffield, while potential deals in Kent include a pair of vintage Austin Seven cars and an unopened bottle of champagne from 1952.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Pickwick Pawnbrokers in south east London, Nathan and manageress Debbs consider a deal on two vintage saxophones, and deliver a surprise when valuing an antique Japanese helmet.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help more people trying to buy a home, beginning in west London. Newlyweds Keon and Zoe are looking for a family house in Shepherd's Bush with space for their hobby of salsa dancing, but even with a budget of £450,000 this will be a challenge for Phil. Kirstie is scouting for properties in the borough of Richmond for Carolyn and Paul - a native of Sheffield who is struggling to get his head around London's inflated prices.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In Liverpool, Phil Spencer helps James and his wife Mairead, who are new to the area and want a property on a budget of £600,000, while Kirstie Allsopp assists fledgling house-hunters Andy and Laura, and it soon becomes apparent the couple have quite different expectations about their first home together.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mother and son Fiona and James Milligan welcome the guests to Derby Manor Hotel and Restaurant in Bournemouth, where the ostentatious decor gets mixed reactions.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Make-up artist and female impersonator Marcus Hunter-Neill hopes to impress with a red carpet-themed evening as he hosts the first party in Belfast. However, his alter ego Lady Portia Diamante steals the limelight as he competes for the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jamaican lifeguard Lenny Irving serves up Caribbean cuisine at the second of the week's dinner parties in Belfast. He also hopes to win over his guests by complementing his menu with strong rum - and seems particularly keen to impress Merchant Navy officer Fiona Rush.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Freelance feminist writer Cat Anderson hosts the third dinner party in Belfast, and hopes to win over her guests with her bohemian chic style and live music. However, her efforts are wasted on lifeguard Lenny Irving, who is only interested in Fiona Rush.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth dinner-party challenge from Belfast is hosted by charity worker and confident cook Rosie Smyth. She decides the best way to win over her guests is to have a `come-as-your-teenage-self' evening, and a zingy mojito cheesecake.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Merchant Navy officer Fiona Rush hosts the final dinner party in Belfast, and hopes to impress with a nautical-themed evening. However, one of her guests is unimpressed with the amount of fish on the menu, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the concluding part of his trip to the Mill Street Bistro in Norwalk, Ohio, Gordon's disagreement with proprietor Joe Nagy erupts into one of his most intense confrontations yet. Just when it looks like he has turned the corner and is ready to accept help, Joe slips back into his old ways, denying his own failings and picking petty fights. Can Gordon get this stubborn owner to finally accept his advice and secure the future of his restaurant?.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to floundering soul food restaurant Blackberry's in Plainfield, New Jersey, but struggles to get his message across to indomitable owner Shelley. Her refusal to deal with the truth comes to a head when Gordon finds a dead mouse in the doorway, prompting him to step up his efforts to change her ways.(n)

programme.title: Homes by the Sea
programme.desc: Charlie Luxton explores the Menai Bridge in Anglesey, Wales, a smuggler's cottage, a working lighthouse that is also a family home, and a cliff-side residence overlooking Snowdonia.(n)

programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Joining chef Michel Roux Jr are First Dates love ambassador Fred Sirieix, food critic Jay Rayner, baker Stacie Stewart, and TV presenter Lucy Alexander. The panel choose between four different brands of prawn cocktail, margherita pizza and vanilla ice cream. Plus, the public taste test oven chips.(n)

programme.title: Supershoppers
programme.desc: Anna Richardson and Andi Osho investigate just how British some iconic Brit products really are, and whether retailer B&M lives up to its `Big Brands, Big Savings' promise. Plus, the swimwear that promises to help shoppers look `10 pounds lighter in 10 seconds'. Should consumers pay for expensive brands or will high street versions do the same slimming trick?.(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner
programme.desc: Premiere. A teen arrives in an isolated community of youngsters, with no memory of who he is or the outside world. When another new arrival brings an ominous message, he realises time is running out for the group and they must find an escape route through a deadly labyrinth if they are to survive. Sci-fi adventure based on James Dashner's novel, starring Dylan O'Brien, Kaya Scodelario and Patricia Clarkson.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A woman travels all the way from Romania in the hope that Professor Noel Fitzpatrick can mend her dog Clifford's squashed spinal cord. A golden Labrador is offered a total shoulder replacement and a puppy faces losing two of its toes after a collision with a plant pot.(n)

programme.title: When Kids Kill
programme.desc: An 18-year-old man inflicted over 70 stab wounds on nurse Cheryl Moss when he murdered her in 2006, influenced by the hours he spent playing on the violent video game, Manhunt.(n)

programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part documentary providing an insight into the lives of London's most notorious street gangs. The film follows young people exposed to murder, drug deals, guns and knives on a daily basis, showing the real-life events taking place every day in London's toughest neighbourhoods.(n)

programme.desc: Drag artist James - aka Dusty Crack - wants to update his Amy Winehouse outfit, but money is tight as he has seen his earnings go down from 100 euros a gig to sometimes as little as 30. Paul and Jacqui run a bar that charges significantly more than other local establishments, but attract customers by offering bingo, quiz nights and British food, while retired Middlesbrough couple Eddie and Pauline are living on a strict budget at Villamar, Benidorm's largest campsite, where they regard their pitch opposite the campsite bins as a bonus.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary focuses on three couples living on benefits. They include Karen and Paul who once ran a launderette, but after losing their business they now struggle to get by on benefits. Yvonne and David are getting married and planning to make it the best day ever - despite only being paid in a year the same amount as the cost of the average UK wedding. Things are even more bleak for Brian and Rachel, however, as despite being together for 10 years, they cannot afford to move in together.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Agents Stewart McCracken and Elmore Victor head to Liverpool for what they expect to be a routine repossession, but instead face the most challenging eviction of their careers. Behind the front door, they find a critically ill two-year-old child with major heart problems, who is on constant life support and unable to breathe without a ventilator. Meanwhile, Brian O'Shaughnessy and Del Anglin chase £2,000 worth of debt owed by a business based in Kent, and recover £4,000 from a recycling business in Buckinghamshire. Plus, Stewart and Elmore encounter another family in crisis in Birmingham, where a retired couple who acted as guarantor for their daughter's tenancy are liable to pay over £3,000 after she defaulted.(n)

programme.title: Dance Moms
programme.desc: Abby's world is shattered when Melissa shares shocking news that looks set to change the face of the ALDC for ever. US reality series about the world of competitive dance.(n)

programme.title: LA Clippers Dance Squad
programme.sub-title: Welcome to the Clippers Dance Squad.
programme.desc: New series. Documentary following the elite LA Clippers dance team, offering a glimpse into its members' high-energy world. A new creative director joins the squad, which finds one veteran struggling to keep up and in danger of losing her job, while a brash rookie rubs her team-mates the wrong way.(n)

programme.title: Gypsy Kids: Our Secret World
programme.desc: The documentary follows 12-year-old English traveller Royston, who spends most of his spare time in the gym training. His first fight was with a bully at school and now he has several titles and is on course to turn professional. But he is not the only one. Twins Johnny and Abraham have also had trouble with bullies and have resorted to fighting back, so before they get into trouble at school, their uncle - a professional cage fighter - is taking them under his wing in a training session. Meanwhile, 10-year-old Annie recently moved from the site where she was born into a house with her mother, but she is missing her friends.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: Stan is given a glimpse of what life was like for Mr Mackey as a 4th grade pupil when the pair bond over their shared hoarding problems.(n)

programme.title: South Park
programme.desc: The 'Coon proves himself to be even more evil than Cthulhu as he punishes his former partners. Meanwhile, Kenny wrestles with the weight of his own super power through his alter-ego, Mysterion.(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: After The Shawshank Redemption , director Frank Darabont stayed inside prison for The Green Mile, based on Stephen King's novel. The title refers to the green strip of lino leading from the condemned cell to the electric chair in Coal Mountain Correctional Facility during the 1930s. Tom Hanks is the head guard of Death Row who just wants life for him, his colleagues and the condemned to be nice and easy, but when Michael Clarke Duncan, a man-mountain convicted of murdering two little white girls, arrives, things start to get strange - how can he cure Hanks' urinary infection with a touch, bring a dead pet mouse back to life and cure the warden's wife's cancer? Is he innocent? And what will happen when his moment of execution arrives? In turns moving and dramatic, at nearly three hours, Darabont has the time to breathe life into the characters and the plot in an almost Dickensian way that rewards the viewers' patience(n)

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biopic charting the life of eccentric film director Howard Hughes over a 20-year period. Breaking into the film industry in 1927, he went on to achieve box-office success, romanced some of his leading ladies and used his millions in an attempt to break the airspeed record(n)

programme.title: Species II
programme.desc: Underwhelming sequel finds an ace astronaut playing host to a new alien that shares a cosmic connection with Sil's sexy clone(n)

programme.title: The Astronaut's Wife
programme.desc: Returning from a routine mission to repair a satellite, astronaut Spencer Armacost briefly loses radio contact with mission control. Spencer lands safely back on Earth, but as time passes his wife's anxiety grows - her husband seems somehow different since his return. And what are the implications for the twins she is now carrying?(n)

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: (1987) Oliver Stone's morality tale stars Charlie Sheen as Bud Fox, an ambitious young stockbroker, who's willing to do whatever it takes to emulate his hero, supremely wealthy financier Gordon Gekko (Michael Douglas). Bud's initial attempts to play the market honestly don't light his touchpaper to success. But, when he passes on some insider information to Gekko, his career starts to pick up pace and, as he becomes increasingly embroiled in illegal trading and financial espionage, he begins to make the money of his dreams. However, he fails to fully comprehend the true cost of his deals until one of them threatens the livelihood of his union boss father (Martin Sheen). Also starring Daryl Hannah and Terence Stamp. M,W,R(n)

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World
programme.desc: Based on a series of books by Patrick O'Brian, MASTER AND COMMANDER plunges viewers deep into the story of a British Navy ship at sea during the Napoleonic war. Russell Crowe stars as Aubrey, the charismatic captain who wrestles with issues like honour, pride, duty, sacrifice and loyalty while using ingenious tactics to engage his prey--a much larger and better-equipped French Man o' War. Paul Bettany plays his friend, the ship's doctor(n)

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop

programme.title: Doctor Detroit

programme.title: The Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: Robert Aldrich's tense and exciting thriller about air crash survivors who are finally forced to try and build a single-engine aircraft from the wreckage of their plane in order to escape from their crash-site in the north African desert(n)

programme.title: Charlie Wilson's War
programme.desc: Political drama based on real-life events about a Texas congressman whose intervention in Afghanistan, supplying weapons and other equipment to rebel troops fighting against the Soviet Union, has far-reaching and unforeseen consequences(n)

programme.title: Sudden Impact
programme.desc: While on a forced holiday due to his feud with a local crime lord, a San Francisco police detective becomes involved with a rape victim who has become a lethal vigilante(n)

programme.title: Enough
programme.desc: Motherless young woman Slim works in a San Francisco diner with her best friend, Ginny. After almost succumbing to the slick flirtation of an insincere customer, she is rescued by another dashing diner named Mitch. A few years later, the now happily married couple seem to have it all -- a perfect house, a precocious daughter, and a comfortable life. Then, Slim discovers that Mitch is actually a lothario who has been sleeping with other women behind her back. When she protests, he slaps her around and uses daughter Gracie as leverage to keep her in line(n)

programme.title: The Cotton Club
programme.desc: There are those who insist that the backstage intrigues which occurred during the production of Cotton Club would make a better film than Cotton Club itself. Essentially, this "dream" project of director Francis Ford Coppola was intended to reflect the passing parade of New York in the 1930s, using Harlem's famed Cotton Club nitery as a metaphor of the era. After innumerable in-progress script changes were made and countless post-production "improvements" were imposed, what emerged was a crazy quilt of varying styles, divergent acting techniques and stop-and-start plotlines. Occasionally, Cotton Club is well up to the standards established by Coppola in his earlier, more successful films. The central character, loosely based on George Raft and played by Richard Gere, is a jazz cornet player at the Cotton Club. Gere saves the life of gangster Dutch Schultz (James Remar), who in gratitude takes Gere under his wing, engaging the young man's services as escort for Schultz's girl friend Diane Lane (guess where this leads?) Meanwhile, Gere's overambitious hoodlum brother Nicolas Cage (playing a character inspired by mobster Mad Dog Coll) kills two innocent children during a mob hit and is forced to go into hiding. Cage holds gangster Frenchy Demarge (Fred Gwynne) as a hostage, but Demarge's safety is negotiated by Owney Madden (Bob Hoskins), the mob owner of the Cotton Club (the touching friendship between Demarge and Madden is one of the few subplots to remain intact in the film's release version). Cage is killed, followed in death shortly afterward by Schultz, who is put "on the spot" by Lucky Luciano (Joe Dallesandro). Gere wins a Hollywood movie contract and heads off to Tinseltown with Diane Lane. These plot convolutions tend to diminish the importance of the black characters who work as Cotton Club entertainers. The intriguing fact that blacks were permitted to perform at the club but were denied access as patrons should have been given as much emphasis as Richard Gere's story; instead, we are left with tantalizingly brief snatches of a romance between Gregory Hines and Lonette McKee, and a few scattered musical numbers involving Hines, his brother Maurice, Charles "Honi" Coles, and a staggeringly good Cab Calloway imitator (Larry T. Marshall). Cotton Club tends to leave the viewer feeling as though several vital ingredients are missing from the recipe, but there is still a lot left over to please the ear and eye(n)

programme.title: Thirteen Conversations About One Thing

programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: No Census, No Feeling. At the start of this comic short, the Three Stooges are unemployed. They've been sleeping in the awning of a swap shop and are rudely awakened when the shop owner unrolls it. After turning the store into a disaster area, the trio run away. They escape to city hall and exit as census takers. Excited over their four-cents-per-head fee, they get working. One place they invade is a mansion during a party. Curly, who has been flirting with the maid in the kitchen, mixes the punch and sweetens it with alum, which he mistakes for powdered sugar. Meanwhile, Moe and Larry somehow get collared by the hostess into playing bridge. When the card players drink the alum-saturated punch, their mouths shrivel up, which makes bidding very difficult. Curly and the maid get into a spat and the hostess, who is in the wrong place at the wrong time, winds up with a dress soaked with punch. The Stooges dash off and find a stadium full of spectators watching a football game. The potential income from all these surveys is very appealing, so the boys sneak into the stadium and start off by trying to survey the players. This doesn't go over very well with the team, and after the Stooges have disrupted the game, the players chase them out of the stadium and into the street(n)

Julie Benz, Graham McTavish(n)

programme.title: Demolition Man
programme.desc: Frozen in 1996, Phoenix a convicted killer is 'thawed' put for parole well into the 21st century. Revived into a crime free society, Phoenix resumes his murderous rampage, and no one can stop him. Spartan, the cop who captured Phoenix in 1996 has also been cryogenically frozen, this time for a crime he didn't commit. In desperation they turn to Spartan to help recapture Phoenix(n)

programme.title: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines
programme.desc: He told us he'd be back... and he wasn't lying! Arnold Schwarzenegger returned to his most famous role in explosive fashion in this blockbuster sequel that cost over $200 million to make. The T-800 comes back from the future to protect the resistance leader John Connor one last time from a superior female terminatrix in the form of Kristanna Loken. Also stars Nick Stahl and Claire Danes(n)

programme.title: See No Evil
programme.desc: A ragtag group of juvenile delinquents assigned the task of cleaning up an abandoned hotel find out just how deadly community service can be when they are stalked by a monstrous, four-hundred-pound maniac with a grudge in director Gregory Dark's wrestling-infused survival horror flick. It was a mere four years ago that seven-foot menace Jacob Goodnight (WWE superstar Kane) was shot in the head and left for dead by a local police officer. But Jacob wasn't going down that easy. With a steel plate subsequently attached to his skull and ten razor-sharp fingernails ready to scrape grey matter from the skulls of his victims, Jacob retreated to the abandoned Blackwell Hotel, where he resided in the darkened, rotting hallways while planning his ultimate revenge. As fate would have it, Jacob wouldn't have to go far to satiate his raging bloodlust, though, and as the unsuspecting teens make their way through the crumbling corridors of the once-luxurious inn guided by the very same policeman who fired that misguided bullet years earlier, the notorious killer sharpens his nails, stalks his prey, and prepares for a little payback(n)

programme.title: Heartbreak Ridge
programme.desc: A misanthropic Marine gunnery sergeant trains new recruits to invade Grenada. Meanwhile, the tough-talking veteran repeatedly runs afoul of his younger, progressive-minded superiors(n)

programme.title: Johnson Family Vacation
programme.desc: The Johnsons set out from California for a family reunion in Missouri. The parents are split up, the kids are arguing - can everyone keep it together for the big day?(n)

programme.title: Trainwreck
programme.desc: A commitment-phobic binge drinker living in New York City must re-evaluate her feelings about intimate relationships when a sports doctor pursues a romance with her. Meanwhile, she must make some hard decisions about her ailing father's long-term care(n)

programme.title: Sugar
programme.desc: This well-acted, introspective sports drama follows Miguel (Algenis Perez Soto), a talented Dominican baseball player longing to break into the American big leagues in order to provide financial support for his family. While paying his dues in the minors, Miguel experiences a variety of cultural and language barriers despite the kindness of his host family. After an injury he must contemplate his role in the world as well as baseball. Rayniel Rufino, Andre Holland(n)

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
programme.desc: Harry experiences a bout of teenage angst as he harbours a crush on a fellow-student at Hogwarts. But a strange prophecy reveals itself, and Harry's wizard exams and raging hormones have to remain in the background as he is called into action once again(n)

programme.title: The Mummy: Tomb of the Dragon Emperor
programme.desc: Explorer Rick O¿Connell (Brendan Frasier) and his wife Evelyn (Maria Bello) are now retired. But they are also quite bored, so when they are invited by the British government to take a precious gem to China they don¿t think twice. The ancient stone is capable of resurrecting the Emperor Han and of pointing the way to Shangri-La. When the couple reaches China, they meet their son Alex, who has discovered the tomb of Han, and Evelyn's brother Jonathan Carnahan. Centuries ago, the evil Emperor Han was cursed by the sorceress Zi Yuan who transformed him and his army into mummies. When the explorers are betrayed by a friend, the mummy is awoken from a 2,000-year-old curse and now threatens to plunge the world into his merciless, unending service(n)

programme.title: The Ring
programme.desc: A young journalist must investigate a mysterious videotape which seems to cause the death of anyone in a week of viewing it(n)

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: Agnes is running away from her ex boyfriend with her new boyfriend Peter. Peter is also on the run from the military - and bugs that he believes is going to take over his body. Together they seek shelter at a small motel. Soon Agnes also sees the bugs' crawling up from every corner witch is the start for a joint battle against the bugs. Slowly paranoia and fear takes over and threatens to destroy them both mentally and physically(n)

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers
programme.desc: Cat-and-mouse chiller in which a brother and sister's journey home from college turns into a terrifying struggle for survival after they make a grim discovery on a remote road(n)

programme.title: The Darkness
programme.desc: A boy stumbles upon an ancient Native American burial ground during a family trip to the Grand Canyon in this skin-crawling tale of terror. He takes five sacred stones from there back home, unaware that they contain a malevolent supernatural force(n)

programme.title: The Strangers
programme.desc: Three masked intruders terrorise a young couple in a secluded country house(n)

programme.title: Max Payne
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg stars as a cop with vengeance on his mind in John Moore's video game-based CGI noir. The eponymous NYPD detective's life is torn apart by the brutal murder of his wife and child. Determined to track down those responsible and wreak bloody revenge, he leaves no stone unturned. His dedication pays off when investigating a tip-off about some drugs dealers(n)

programme.title: Traders
programme.desc: A man's business goes under, threatening to derail his posh existence. In a desperate attempt to keep his life as he knows it, he agrees to cash out his entire life savings and put it all on the line in a diabolical, winner-takes-all fight to the death(n)

programme.title: The Abandoned
programme.desc: In this spooky and surreal chiller, an American movie producer (Anastasia Hille) searching for her birth parents inherits a house in Russia that holds dark and dangerous secrets from her past. Directed by Nacho Cerda(n)

programme.title: Bird on a Wire
programme.desc: Quick-witted and fast-paced action-comedy: Mel Gibson, his cover blown after years on the FBI Witness Protection Program, finds his life threatened by a murderous gang of drug dealers. Charitably, he drags ex-girlfriend Goldie Hawn into the deadly milieu and together the pair set off on a crazy cross-country adventure(n)

programme.title: Cobra
programme.desc: Youth action thriller about three boys who get mixed up in plans to assassinate the US Secretary of State. Fortunately the boys are experts at their given hobbies, and their talents prove to be the decisive factor(n)

programme.title: The Dead Pool
programme.desc: The fifth film to feature Clint Eastwood's immortal 'Dirty' Harry Callahan, The Dead Pool is a crime thriller that sees celebrities being killed in mysterious circumstances. While Harry is investigating the death of rock star Johnny Squares (Jim Carrey), who died on location filming a movie directed by Peter Swan (Liam Neeson), he begins to get suspicious. Harry discovers that Swan and several other people are playing a game called the dead pool, wherein they make a list of famous people who they think may die and place large sums of money on the outcome. Squares was on Swan's list, as were a number of other recently deceased - and when Harry sees his own name he knows it's time to act fast. With cameos and music from Guns n'Roses(n)

programme.title: The Purge: Election Year

programme.title: Rules of Engagement

Jackson) fought alongside Hodges and once saved his life; when Childers is threatened with a court martial for ordering his troops to fire on civilians during a raid on an American embassy, Hodges is the only lawyer that he can trust, and the case gives Hodges a chance for revenge against the military system that he feels has wronged him. programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Alex Jones host the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests.(n)

programme.title: Eat Well for Less
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help the Brook family from Nottingham lower their food bills, and show them ways to follow a healthier diet while saving money on their weekly shop. Daughters Rosie and Sophia prefer snacking on sugary treats than following a healthy, balanced diet, and their fussy eating habits mean Mum Janine is forced to cook separate meals for the family each night.(n)

programme.title: The Met: Policing London
programme.desc: PC Paul Molyneux is on the hunt for Ealing's most wanted burglars. Staking out the park car of a well-known criminal, Paul and his colleague Katy are thrown into a 60mph car chase when he fails to stop for them. Meanwhile in Newham, east London, Detective Colin Shaw and his team work undercover to take down a group of drug dealers operating in the area, and elsewhere, a crucial lead has come through for murder detectives investigating the tragic death of an elderly man in north London.(n)

programme.title: Room 101 - Extra Storage
programme.desc: Extended edition of the comedy panel show presented by Frank Skinner, with Joe Lycett, Ricky Wilson and Zoe Lyons competing to have their pet hates consigned to Room 101, with topics including new towels, escalators and bartenders.(n)

programme.title: Supermarket Secrets
programme.desc: New series. Gregg Wallace returns with the programme that goes behind the scenes with Britain's biggest food retailers, finding out how they are using the latest science and technology to stay ahead of the competition. Gregg discovers the hi-tech acoustic testing Asda are using to get an edge in the battle to bring customers the perfect avocado, while Babita Sharma learns about the intelligence gatherers who know more about what shoppers buy and why than they do.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer

Plus, the imitation children's scooters scaring parents, and a look at what is really inside a counterfeit iPhone. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Housing Enforcers

programme.title: Yes Chef
programme.desc: Matt Gillan puts three cooks through a series of culinary challenges, including how to make poached eggs with hazelnut emulsion. Only one of the amateurs can join him in the final.(n)

programme.title: Street Auction
programme.desc: Paul Martin and Danny Sebastian are in Swindon, where they surprise double amputee Bonny Walsh when they reveal that the funds they have been raising are all for her.(n)

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and the team present the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kush spends a pleasant birthday looking after Arthur, only for things to take a downward turn after an incident in the park involving Denise and Keegan - with the latter threatening to call the police. Billy is disappointed when the unveiling for the newly named funeral directors does not go to plan, Michelle agrees to a date with her tube train acquaintance Tom, and Jack employs a new nanny.(n)

programme.title: Kat and Alfie: Redwater
programme.desc: Things reach a tense conclusion as matters come to a head in the Irish drama. Peter is still missing following his row with Dermott, so Eileen and Roisin set out to find him - although it seems Agnes is worried what long-kept secrets he may give up if he is found. Padraig offers a shoulder to cry on for granddaughter Adeen, who has been in emotional turmoil ever since Lance's death, Bernie finally pieces together the truth about the old man's demise, and Dermott returns to Redwater - where Kat finally learns her son's secret. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.sub-title: DIY SOS: The Big Build: Telford.
programme.desc: The building crusaders come to the aid of 12-year-old Matthew from Telford, who has been stuck in hospital for three years after suffering cancer and a stroke. The youngster's head teacher and school friends have been fundraising to get him home, so now, Nick Knowles and the team - with the help of hundreds of volunteers - set out to make Matthew's home suitable for his complex medical needs.(n)

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the debate from Plymouth, with a panel of politicians and other guests facing topical questions from the audience.(n)

programme.title: This Week
programme.desc: Andrew Neil introduces a round-table chat, in which he, Michael Portillo and other guests take a look back at the past seven days' political and parliamentary developments.(n)

programme.title: Emergency Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: Two British police officers hunt for criminals on the streets of Australia, and discover one of their suspects is another Brit. Plus, freak weather brings some bizarre casualties for an emergency vet from Bristol.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Natasha Raskin Sharp oversees proceedings as Tim Weeks and Caroline Hawley help two teams look for items at the South of England Showground in Ardingly, West Sussex.(n)

programme.title: Yes Chef

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Joe Swift, Carol Klein and Adam Frost take an exclusive look at the new RHS Chatsworth Flower Show, meeting designer Jo Thompson as she prepares her show garden with a difference. In the Floral Pavilion, Carol finds pioneering plants that have shaped the gardens of today, while garden designer Arit Anderson looks to the future - meeting the team behind a garden built for the changing climate.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Property series in which people get the chance to experience life in Australia or New Zealand before deciding whether they want to make the move permanently.(n)

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team explores secret paths around the shores of the British Isles. Nick Crane heads to Cape Wrath - the most north-westerly point of the UK mainland - to visit his favourite beach, and learns how the area was once home to Britain's smallest school and why this wild landscape had to be abandoned. Ruth Goodman reveals how a Victorian craze for collecting ferns drove genteel women to extraordinary lengths on the perilous paths along the sea cliffs of Devon, while Adam McIntosh follows a secret underwater path off the isle of Iona in search of green marble.(n)

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Tom Hollander presents an appeal on behalf of IntoUniversity, a charity that provides local learning centres in some of the UK's most deprived communities.(n)

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The AEGON Championships. Sue Barker introduces coverage of the third day of the famous grass-court tournament, where the second round of the men's singles is scheduled to get under way at Queen's Club. Eventual winner Andy Murray defeated fellow Brit Aljaz Bedene at this stage in 2016 to set up a quarter-final clash against another British opponent in Kyle Edmund. With commentary by Andrew Castle, Andrew Cotter, John Lloyd and Peter Fleming, and reports from John Inverdale.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers.(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: Kate Humble hosts the panel show that tests the wildlife knowledge of team captains Chris Packham and Lucy Cooke, with guests Martin Hughes-Games and Linsdey Chapman.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.desc: Mary opens her garden to host a village fete and shares her flair for turning easy dishes into spectacular crowd-pleasers, and she is visited by two brothers for a lesson in the art of making authentic Italian pizzas.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The entrants representing Northern Ireland, Tommy Heaney, Joery Castel and Eddie Attwell, go all out to impress with their main courses. Barbecued dishes are on the menu for two of the chefs, with Tommy creating a surf and turf combination, while Joery aims to recreate a more American style barbecue, and Eddie opts for an unusual meat, water buffalo, for the centrepiece of his main course.(n)

programme.title: The Greatest Tomb On Earth: Secrets of Ancient China
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Alice Roberts and Albert Lin explore the final resting place of China's first emperor, a site 200 times larger than Egypt's Valley of the Kings and home to the famous Terracotta Warriors. Making use of both the latest forensic technology and ancient texts, they delve into this historic site's secrets and uncover evidence that casts a new light on the founding of the nation.(n)

programme.title: Brexit Means Brexit
programme.desc: Award-winning director Patrick Forbes goes beyond the headlines to film the battle to govern Britain, after last year's Referendum vote on 23rd June 2016. Filmed over one extraordinary year since the public voted to leave the European Union, it is a story of low politics, high ambition and bitter personal animosities, with the biggest decision the country has faced in decades at stake. Can the Prime Minister tame the judges, the opposition, and finally the public to deliver Brexit?.(n)

programme.title: White Gold
programme.desc: Vincent's life takes a turn for the worse as he finds himself kicked out of his family home and in debt to the Inland Revenue to the tune of £50,000. Meanwhile, Lavender, having his own career crisis, is drawn back to the world of rock and roll, and invites Sam along to a gig.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Hospital
programme.desc: The documentary charting the day-to-day realities faced by workers in the NHS returns, picking up with staff at St Mary's Hospital in London on March 22nd, the day of the Westminster terror attack. St Mary's is one of the capital's four Major Trauma Centres, and staff are well-versed in Major Incident Protocols that come into effect in the wake of events such as terrorist activity. Arrangements are made to transfer some of the hospital's critically ill patients to a sister site at Charring Cross, giving the A&E team more scope to help the victims, including teenagers Yann and Victor; French students in London on a school trip. Also admitted is Stephen, who needs immediate surgery to save his leg, and his wife Cara shares her thoughts on the helplessness felt by the families of those most gravely injured as a result of these incidents.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Although oceans define the earth and are crucial to life, recent discoveries have revealed that they are not unique to earth. Oceans have been located across the solar system, and scientists are now embarking on a journey in search of new life in places that never seemed possible. With NASA planning to dive to the depths of a strange, distant ocean in a remarkable submarine, the programme discovers that the hunt for oceans in space is marking the dawn of a new era in the search for alien life.(n)

programme.title: Child of Our Time
programme.desc: Part two of two. Professors Robert Winston and Tanya Byron follow the youngsters through their GCSE year to discover how the teenagers are being shaped by these unique times. In Scotland, Nathan shares how it feels growing up in an unconventional family - attitudes to his father's homosexuality have transformed in his lifetime. And in Essex, Taliesin reveals what impact his online gaming habit is having on friendships and his sleep.(n)

programme.title: Morocco to Timbuktu: An Arabian Adventure
programme.desc: Writer and explorer Alice Morrison embarks on a camel trek over the dunes of the Sahara, 3.5 million square miles of desert, for the second and final part of her journey to Timbuktu. Along the way she visits a livestock market that centuries ago provided merchants with their camels, before reaching her final destination. Far from the legendary City of Gold, Timbuktu is a city where UN solders keep a fragile peace after an incursion by Islamic extremists in 2012. Alice relives the city's glorious past with a visit to its world famous mosques, meets the Tuaregs - desert nomads who have sought refuge in there - and celebrates at a party with her newfound friends.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Documentary telling how the world's smallest animals manage to survive, revealing how they have evolved extraordinary skills and achieved mindboggling feats. From the animal kingdom's greatest artist to the tiny creatures that provide people with so much of the air they breathe, the programme discovers what it takes to be a miniature miracle. Hugh Dennis narrates.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Actor and comedian Brian Conley invites presenter Eamonn Holmes to choose the TV programmes that have shaped his life and career. Featured shows include Second World War drama Colditz, children's classic Animal Magic and sci-fi series Star Trek.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

At the same time they have to prepare all the elements needed to perform a spectacular piece of gourmet theatre known as live table plating, creating a dessert drawing on the theme of tropical fruits.(n)

programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: BBC Newsroom Live

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country. Presented by Andrew Neil.(n)

programme.title: Tennis: Queen's
programme.desc: The AEGON Championships. Sue Barker introduces coverage of the fourth day of the famous grass-court tournament, where the second round of the men's singles concludes at Queen's Club. The most exciting match of the round last year was arguably John Isner v Gilles Muller, which the unseeded Luxembourgish player eventually won in three sets to set up a quarter-final meeting with Australian Bernard Tomic. With commentary by Andrew Castle, Andrew Cotter, John Lloyd and Peter Fleming, and reports from John Inverdale.(n)

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Jeremy Vine, in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers.(n)

programme.title: Curious Creatures
programme.desc: Team captains Chris Packham and Lucy Cooke are joined by Steve Leonard and Christy Harrison for another test of wildlife knowledge, hosted by Kate Humble.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Everyday
programme.desc: The food writer and former Great British Bake Off judge continues to celebrate the everyday food and ingredients she has always loved, from hearty and wholesome ideas to easy-to-make crowd-pleasers and family classics. In this edition, Mary focuses on food that exemplifies indulgence, demonstrating mouth-watering dishes that give the mundane a lift with lashings of naughtiness. Treats are in store as she investigates the history of the British pie and reveals the secrets to making an easy sticky toffee pudding.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Northern Ireland chefs Eddie Attwell, Tommy Heaney and Joery Castel prepare their desserts, knowing this is the last chance to impress before one of them has to leave the competition. Two of them attempt technical dishes featuring edible chocolate tennis balls, while the third cooks a traditional Dutch pancake. Which two will make it through to tomorrow?.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a tree fern in the damp garden and uses netting to protect his soft fruits from birds. Carol Klein selects hardy geraniums as her Plant of the Month, Flo Headlam visits an inspiring church garden in Lewisham that feeds both the mind and body, and Nick Bailey gets an insight into the impact of parasitoid wasps on gardens.(n)

programme.title: Who Should We Let In? Ian Hislop on the First Great Immigration Row
programme.desc: As Brexit Britain prepares to draw up new rules on who is welcome in the UK, Ian Hislop explores the decades from the Victorian era to the First World War, when modern Britain introduced its first peacetime restrictions on immigration. Until then, the Victorians had an open door to foreigners, but rising numbers in the late 19th-century triggered a fierce disagreement over who should be allowed in, mirroring the ongoing modern-day debate.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Gary Delaney, Ed Gamble, Kerry Godliman and Nish Kumar. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.sub-title: The End of the Solar System.
programme.desc: The story of how the solar system will be transformed by the ageing Sun, before coming to an end in approximately eight billion years. Astronomers can predict how it will happen by analysing distant galaxies, stars and planets in their final moments, and the programme brings these predictions to life with a giant scale model of the solar system spread out all over a town in the American Midwest.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins this leg of his journey in the East Yorkshire town of Hessle, where he learns about the technology that made the Humber Bridge possible. In nearby Hull, Michael hears from local MP Alan Johnson about anti-slavery campaigner William Wilberforce, before travelling to Scarborough Castle, where the founder of the Quaker movement was once imprisoned. His last stop of the day is York, where he learns what made the city a centre for the sweet-making industry.(n)

programme.title: Sound of Cinema: The Music That Made the Movies
programme.desc: Neil Brand celebrates the art of the film soundtrack by exploring the work of movie composers and demonstrating their techniques. He begins by looking at how the classical orchestral score emerged, and investigates how its popularity remains strong today. He sheds light on the 1930s European composers such as Max Steiner and Erich Wolfgang Korngold, who brought their Viennese training to Hollywood for movies including King Kong and The Adventures of Robin Hood, and how it took an American talent to produce a darker, more modern sound. He also meets film-maker Martin Scorsese and composer Hans Zimmer to discuss their work.(n)

programme.title: Burton and Taylor
programme.desc: Having battled a series of personal struggles during rehearsals, former spouses Richard Burton and Elizabeth Taylor prepare to star in a 1983 production of Private Lives. Critical reception is initially poor following the opening performance, but members of the audience - picking up on the parallels between the Noel Coward comedy and the lead actors' own situations - respond far more enthusiastically. Drama based on real-life events, starring Dominic West and Helena Bonham Carter.(n)

programme.title: Parkinson: The Interviews
programme.sub-title: Parkinson: The Richard Burton Interview: Richard Burton.
programme.desc: In a programme first shown in August 1995, the chat show host reflects on a 1974 interview with Welsh actor Richard Burton, who became as famous for his off-screen romances with Elizabeth Taylor as his roles in films including Where Eagles Dare, Who's Afraid of Virginia Woolf? and Cleopatra.(n)

programme.title: Locomotion: Dan Snow's History of Railways
programme.desc: The historian and broadcaster examines how in just 50 years, Britain's railways grew from a handful of small lines carrying coal to become the nations' biggest industry. The emergence of the rail network changed working conditions for British employees, proved a valuable export across the globe and even changed the way war was waged. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Fair Cop: A Century of British Policewomen
programme.desc: Marking the 100th anniversary of the first British policewoman being given the power of arrest, this documentary examines the history of the female police force, featuring a look at the careers and aspirations of key former and serving officers. Ex-workers include Cressida Dick, its highest ever ranking female officer, Alison Halford, who brought a sex discrimination charge against the force, Jackie Malton, who provided the model for Prime Suspect's Jane Tennison, and Sislin Fay Allen, the nation's first black policewoman.(n)

programme.title: Scotland's Home Movies: Memories on Film
programme.desc: The history of home movies on cine film in Scotland, featuring footage from various eras and interviews with the people who appeared in them. The programme examines the beginning of the hobby in the 1920s, when equipment was cumbersome and expensive, and how it has documented changes in society over the following decades as advances in technology made cameras available to people from all walks of life. Narrated by Richard Madden.(n)

programme.title: The Genius of Turner: Painting the Industrial Revolution
programme.desc: Docu-drama revealing there is more to painter JMW Turner than his famous landscapes, examining key paintings incorporating machines, science and technology that reflect the scientific and industrial revolutions he lived through. Including interviews with historian Simon Schama and artist Tracey Emin. Narrated by Samuel West, with Thomas Coombes portraying Turner.(n)

programme.title: 100 Days
programme.desc: BBC News teams in Washington DC and London report on the events that are shaping the world.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Simon Bates and Peter Powell present the January 19 show, featuring music by Whitesnake, Big Country, Fiction Factory, China Crisis, Gloria Gaynor, John Lennon and Paul McCartney.(n)

programme.title: Ireland's Treasures Uncovered
programme.desc: Documentary about the Irish artefacts that have helped to shape and create modern Ireland, both north and south. Alice Roberts and Gavin Hughes uncover the tales behind treasures such as the Tara Brooch, the Broighter Hoard, the Waterford Charter Roll and others.(n)

programme.title: Japan: Earth's Enchanted Islands
programme.desc: In the south-west of Japan, the Ryukyu Islands stretch towards the tropics and all life on them is influenced by the power of the sea, with volcanos and typhoons forces to be reckoned with. Michelle Dockery narrates a journey beginning at an island at the top of the chain and travelling south, revealing unexpected stories of isolation, unique wildlife and unsolved mysteries.(n)

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: BBC Filmmaker Natalie Hewit spent three months in Antarctica following the work of the everyday heroes who have been challenged to move a vital polar research station, Halley VI. Built on the Brunt Ice Shelf, it sits far beyond the Antarctic shoreline, but a crevasse in the surrounding ice threatens to send the station adrift.(n)

programme.title: Planet Oil
programme.sub-title: Planet Oil: The Treasure That Conquered the World.
programme.desc: Iain Stewart reveals that huge technological advances are helping extend the life of existing oil and gas fields, while new sources such as shale gas and tar sands will provide for the hydrocarbon age well into the 21st century. He examines whether continuing to extract oil risks catastrophic climate change, and looks at alternative energy supplies that could help make the transition to a low-carbon future. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami

programme.title: Gunsmoke

programme.title: Touched by an Angel

programme.title: Judge Judy

programme.title: Judge Judy

programme.title: Bad Girls

programme.desc: Episode 629. programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 420. The Sharks get a taste of sugar-free nut butters; and learn about a stylish wristband that promises relief from nausea. Also: a device for removing tattoos; shoes with interchangeable heels; and an update on surf-inspired fitness equipment invested in by Mark(n)

programme.title: Shark Tank
programme.desc: Episode 725. programme.title: Jay Leno's Garage

programme.title: Jay Leno's Garage
programme.desc: Original and Unrestored. Unrestored classic cars are featured when Jay rides in one of Jerry Seinfeld's Porsches; goes road-racing with Patrick Dempsey; and meets a collector in Las Vegas with 33 1941 Cadillacs(n)

programme.title: Will & Grace
