programme.title: Pathfinder
programme.desc: The sole survivor of a Viking "dragon" vessel shipwrecked on the eastern shores of the New World 15 years ago provides the only hope for the a Native American tribe faced with certain destruction by Norse berserkers in director Marcus Nispel's (The Texas Chainsaw Massacre) dark action adventure. Reared by the Wampanoag tribe following a failed attempt by the Vikings to raid coastal villages for slaves, a ten-year-old shipwreck survivor is nicknamed "Ghost" by his adoptive tribe due to his pale complexion and blond hair. Legend says that death and destruction will follow the boy wherever he travels, yet the peaceful people of the Wampanoag tribe selflessly take the frightened child in as if he is one of their own. Over the course of the following decade, the adopted young Norseman eventually grows into a strong warrior (Karl Urban) determined to prove his worth to the people he calls family. When the rampaging Vikings return to the New World to rain destruction down on the Native Americans and to claim the fertile land of the peaceful people, Ghost finds himself in the precarious position of having to stop his own people from destroying his village and ruthlessly slaughtering the woman he loves (Moon Bloodgood). Now, as Ghost's true destiny is revealed by the powerful shaman known as the Pathfinder (Russell Means), the fearless warrior sets out to stage a savage one-man war on the marauding Vikings and become the savior once prophesied to defend the Wampanoag people in their darkest hour(n)

The legion was led by Marcus' father, and the strange disappearance has hurt his family's reputation, prompting Marcus to make the arduous journey to learn the truth about what happened. Directed by Kevin MacDonald(n)

programme.desc: Documentary heading to both the shop floor and the head office of bargain retail chain Poundland, to discover how the struggling business has fared in the 12 months following the result of the UK EU Referendum. Just weeks after Britain voted to leave the EU, Poundland was taken over by a new leadership team, which was tasked with turning the ailing company around. As the value of the pound dropped, shoppers became ever-more hungry for bargains, and Poundland struggled to keep prices low enough to remain a competitive force in the market-place.(n)

programme.desc: The dog-loving funnyman pays another visit to Battersea, where he falls for the toothless boxer Prince. The pair hit it off immediately, leaving Paul to wonder whether he should rehome the canine himself. But there is bad news - Prince has a suspicious lump on his leg that requires urgent attention. Paul also meets Yorkshire terrier Dash, whose bark has lost its bite leaving him with a very unusual, squeaky voice. Broadcaster and journalist Piers Morgan travels across the USA to meet some of America's most notorious female murderers, in a quest to discover what drives a woman to kill. He travels to Lowell Correctional Institute in Florida to talk to Rebecca Fenton, convicted for the murder of her husband Larry, who was shot dead in their home. He also looks into the details of the case, learning how for several years it seemed she was going to get away with the crime, until the involvement of the FBI helped bring her to justice.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The Griffins visit Lois's pregnant sister and help deliver her baby, who catches them off guard by putting in a premature appearance. Exhilarated, they decide to try for another child of their own - but Stewie is horrified and tries every trick in the book to prevent conception.(n)

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg tries to get friendly with the in-crowd at school, but becomes the target of their cruel mockery. programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: The Griffins seek refuge from burglars in a panic room, where Peter whiles away the time by telling Lois and the kids all about their history - including stories of their cavemen ancestors.(n)

programme.sub-title: Two Foot Two, Eyes of Blue.

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Lord Ashfordly's sister arrives in Aidensfield with a renowned Polish violinist and his daughter, intending to stage a concert at the village hall. programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Simmering tensions in the Goddard household come to a head as Ruth gives Simon his marching orders, enraged to discover he's remortgaged the house without consulting her. Meanwhile, Stephen reacts badly to the news that fellow teacher Martin Williams has attempted suicide - and responds by seeking solace in Jacqui's arms. Sarah Lancashire, Jason Done, Pam Ferris and Tony Haygarth star.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the storm, Rowan takes charge of the situation as the residents try to free Charlotte from beneath the rubble and rescue Danny, who has been left behind by Alice in her desperate search for help. Vanessa and Rowan use a helicopter to eventually spot him lying unconscious in the Bush and take him home. The next morning, Alice decides to pack her bags and leave, but a kiss from Danny might prompt a change of heart.(n)

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: The green-fingered team returns with more surprise garden makeovers for deserving people across the nation. Darren and Lesley Chan's youngest daughter Amelie was born with Charge syndrome - a debilitating genetic condition that has left her deaf, partially sighted and in need of constant care. Alan Titchmarsh sets out to transform the Manchester family's neglected outdoor space, calling in David Domoney, Frances Tophill and Katie Rushworth to introduce sensory planting for the 10-year-old, a shade-loving border and a multifunction pathway made from areas of decking, artificial turf and paving.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Sgt Merton finds himself under pressure when teenagers commit serious offences in the area and must race to stop a planned `chicken run' with stolen cars. The youngsters are also suspected of drug dealing after Liz Merrick hands in amphetamines found in a local boy's bedroom, and Merton's investigative techniques lead Jenny to call off the wedding. Starring Duncan Bell, Sarah Tansey and Aislin McGuckin.(n)

programme.title: The Royal

Was the crime calculated or opportunistic? And why was she elaborately tied up after being murdered? As the detectives dig for clues, they are led into a world of suburban swinging and fetish photography, far removed from the Oxford they know. Gary Kemp (The Krays), Lucy Cohu (The Awakening), Ciaran McMenamin (Primeval) and Georgia Taylor (Casualty) guest star.(n)

programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh comes to the aid of a couple who founded a charity to support bereaved families after the loss of their 23-month-old son. Alan and the team set about transforming it into four distinct spaces, featuring a kitchen garden and a tranquil seating area, and show viewers how to tackle a towering leylandii hedge.(n)

programme.desc: PC Steve Crane takes an urgent phone call, and is shocked to discover Peter Pyke's warehouse has gone up in smoke. Meanwhile, Vernon moves into his new mansion, but has trouble keeping up with his well-to-do neighbours. Rural drama, starring James Carlton, Duncan Bell and Geoffrey Hughes.(n)

programme.title: Live 2017 FIFA Confederations Cup
programme.desc: Russia v Portugal (Kick-off 4.00pm). Coverage of both teams' second Group A encounter, held at Spartak Stadium in Moscow, Russia. The last time these sides met was in a 2015 friendly, when Russia won 1-0 in Kuban, courtesy of Roman Shirokov's late winner. However, the Portuguese were without the considerable presence of Cristiano Ronaldo on that occasion, and the Real Madrid star will be looking to make an impact on this tournament following a highly successful club campaign. Presented by Mark Pougatch with commentary by Sam Matterface and Danny Higginbotham, and analysis from Lee Dixon and Jimmy Floyd Hasselbaink.(n)

programme.title: Live 2017 FIFA Confederations Cup
programme.desc: Mexico v New Zealand (Kick-off 7.00pm). Coverage of both teams' second Group A encounter, held at Fisht Olympic Stadium in Sochi, Russia. Mexico won this competition on home soil in 1999 and were also semi-finalists in 1995 and 2005, though they failed to reach the knockout rounds when the tournament was last held four years ago. New Zealand have taken part on three occasions, most recently in 2009, but are yet to progress beyond the group stage. Presented by Jacqui Oatley, with commentary by Joe Speight and Ian Dowie, and analysis from Glenn Hoddle and Matthew Upson.(n)

programme.title: Live 2017 FIFA Confederations Cup
programme.desc: Germany v Chile (Kick-off 7.00pm). Coverage of both teams' second Group B encounter, held at Kazan Arena in Russia, as the world champions take on the reigning Copa America title-holders. The sides last met in a friendly in March 2014, when Germany's Mario Goetze scored the only goal of the game, just as he did in that year's World Cup final against Argentina. However, such is the strength-in-depth that Joachim Loew's men possess, Goetze is unlikely to make the squad this time around. Presented by Jacqui Oatley, with commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Iain Dowie, and analysis from Lee Dixon and Glenn Hoddle.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Terry is having a hard time coming to terms with Jay's death, blaming himself for the tragedy and brooding over his own future - and the threatening behaviour of a sick child's father proves the last straw. programme.desc: As the trial of local teenager Gary Bell approaches, Sidney and Geordie find themselves in disagreement regarding his guilt. programme.title: How I Met Your Mother

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.sub-title: The Other Side of This Life
programme.desc: The Other Side of This Life. Conclusion. In Los Angeles, Addison deals with a difficult delivery after hearing bad news about her own fertility. She's also reminded that there's "an empty office" at the Oceanside Wellness Center. In Seattle, Derek performs emergency surgery on Ava as Alex lends emotional support; doctors find the cause of Susan Grey's hiccups; and Burke and George ask Bailey for marital advice. Susan Grey: Mare Winningham. Pete: Tim Daly. Violet: Amy Brenneman. Jane Burke: Diahann Carroll(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: Testing 1-2-3. All but one of the interns are fully prepared to take the first-year exams. Meredith (Ellen Pompeo) and her father have finally come to an understanding, which is more than can be said for Meredith and Derek (Patrick Dempsey). Burke (Isaiah Washington) and Cristina (Sandra Oh) are just a few hours away from becoming husband and wife. Callie (Sara Ramirez) is beginning to figure out what went on between George (T.R. Knight) and Izzie (Katherine Heigl) on that drunken evening. Ava (Elizabeth Reaser) finally regains her memory and identifies herself as "Rebecca Pope"--but this is anything but good news for Alex (Justin Chambers). And in addition to three injured mountain climbers, the hospital admissions room includes such familiar faces as Adele Webber (Loretta Devine) and Joe the Bartender (Steven W. Bailey)(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.sub-title: Didn't We Almost Have It All
programme.desc: Didn't We Almost Have It All. Callie and George make a big decision. A successor to Chief Webber is named. A man named Jeff Pope arrives. He is looking for his wife and newborn child. Cristina and Burke's wedding day has arrived and so have the interns exam results(n)

programme.title: Grey's Anatomy
programme.desc: A Change Is Gonna Come. In the Season 4 opener, Cristina returns from her "honeymoon" and begins looking for Burke. programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.sub-title: Falmouth, Cornwall v Kotor Bay, Montenegro.
programme.desc: Property experts Jasmine Harman and Laura Hamilton assist Lisa and Tony Edwards, who want to buy a property in either Falmouth on Cornwall's south coast, or Kotor Bay, Montenegro, where they were married three years previously.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Following the work of `Bionic Vet' Noel Fitzpatrick and his team at a pioneering veterinary practice. Maya, a Russian Blue cat, is brought into the surgery with a shattered jaw after a dog attack, and a man living in a homeless shelter brings in his best friend Spud, a Labrador cross with a lame back leg. Plus, Noel tries to help straighten a deformity in a six-month-old Chihuahua puppy's leg.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B competition heads to France as four British expats compete, beginning with Lisanne Ashton, who runs the rural Les Chimeres in the south of the country. After searching for truffles in the surrounding area, guest Tony Horton's passion for the royal family causes him to clash with fellow competitor Shaun Baggs, whose mood is worsened by the discovery of bugs in his bed.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition continues at Le Manoir in the Dordogne, owned by royalist Tony Horton and his Armenian wife Shou Shou - who make a poor first impression by presenting guests with a timetable specifying when they are allowed to use the bathroom. A vinegar-tasting session also receives a tepid response, and some of the visitors are bemused by their hosts turning up for breakfast in costume.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Wine-loving Shaun Baggs and his partner Patrick Weaver bring the contest to Le Clos Rabelais in central France, where they invite fellow competitors to take part in a traditional French dance class. Tension mounts as George and Linda become increasingly frustrated with Lisanne, and the bickering continues over dinner when Shaun is confronted about his previous negative feedback.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: George and Linda McGill welcome their guests to the Moulin de la Civiere near Rostrenen in Brittany, where entertainment comes in the shape of a tenpin-bowling outing, and the couple lay on a full English breakfast. However, the hosts receive an unexpected surprise at feedback time courtesy of Lisanne.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A range of properties in Bournemouth, Dorset, and Sicily provide food for thought for the owners of a B&B in northern France, who are ready for a slower pace of life in a different country.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Laura Hamilton come to the aid of creative couple Victor and Penny from London. The pair are searching for a relaxing getaway and must choose between buying a home in Kent, which would make for an easy weekend commute, or finding a property in Penny's preferred location, Florence in Italy.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team join forces with staff from Queen's University in Belfast to excavate a 4,000-year-old monument at Knockdhu on the coast of Co Antrim. Braving the elements in this remote location, they come to appreciate how it has remained undisturbed for so long and uncover evidence of a sophisticated, if warlike, society.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Salisbury Cathedral: Buried Bishops and Belfries.
programme.desc: At the turn of the millennium, bones were discovered in an area of Salisbury Cathedral that once housed the personal chapel of the bishop Richard Beauchamp. Tony Robinson and the crew spend three days digging in the grounds, using their expert knowledge to identify the remains and unearth the original bell tower, as well as evidence of the people who constructed the medieval building.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend head to Leighton Buzzard in Bedfordshire to help Richard and Tracy finish restoring a 1968 Morris Traveller for their son Justin.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Senior neurologist Dr Colin Driver comes up with an unconventional solution to treat a nurse's cat, which has been rushed into the surgery after being poisoned. Meanwhile, the owners of a rare Polish sheepdog with a failed fracture repair on a broken leg are faced with the option of having the leg removed, or trying an innovative total elbow replacement. Plus, a self-confessed `crazy cat lady' brings in a ginger tom which urgently needs leg surgery.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of two architects who are planning to build an eco-friendly subterranean house underneath a ruined 300-year-old barn in the Cotswolds. In one of the most challenging projects seen on the programme, Helen and Chris Seymour Smith build a steel frame around the barn while they excavate underneath, aiming to create a home that is airtight and needs no heating.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Couple Andrei and Abby aim to demolish their damaged cottage in South New Brighton, Christchurch and build a prototype earthquake-proof family home. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Secrets of Sleep
programme.desc: New series. A documentary series following 12 people with debilitating sleep disorders, as they attempt to overcome their troubled nights and transform their lives.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr invites Sean Lock and Isy Suttie to go up against Jon Richardson and Richard Osman in the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz. Alex Horne and the Horne Section join resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Vic Reeves and Aisling Bea join host Jimmy Carr and team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson for more comic innuendos, unpredictable conundrums and unforgivable puns in the comedy quiz. David O'Doherty is with Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs New Zealand
programme.desc: Couple Andrei and Abby aim to demolish their damaged cottage in South New Brighton, Christchurch and build a prototype earthquake-proof family home. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of two architects who are planning to build an eco-friendly subterranean house underneath a ruined 300-year-old barn in the Cotswolds. In one of the most challenging projects seen on the programme, Helen and Chris Seymour Smith build a steel frame around the barn while they excavate underneath, aiming to create a home that is airtight and needs no heating.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Teams captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock are joined by guests Louie Spence, Joe Wilkinson, Elis James and Shappi Khorsandi for an extended edition of the irreverent quiz featuring questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country. Hosted by Jimmy Carr.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A range of properties in Bournemouth, Dorset, and Sicily provide food for thought for the owners of a B&B in northern France, who are ready for a slower pace of life in a different country.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Senior neurologist Dr Colin Driver comes up with an unconventional solution to treat a nurse's cat, which has been rushed into the surgery after being poisoned. Meanwhile, the owners of a rare Polish sheepdog with a failed fracture repair on a broken leg are faced with the option of having the leg removed, or trying an innovative total elbow replacement. Plus, a self-confessed `crazy cat lady' brings in a ginger tom which urgently needs leg surgery.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Owner Helen Marriott offers her guest a chance to `step off the planet' and treats them to essential breathing lessons, a chance to get to know one another in the hot tub, and soul-soothing foot massages at the Fountain's Court Holistic Health Hotel in the North Yorkshire resort of Scarborough.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants head to the Whittington & Cat, a pub in Hull that also offers B&B. Proprietor Sue Perkins treats her guests to an afternoon of ice hockey, but they are intrigued by the possible contents of her peculiarly titled breakfast menu.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Khurram Saba hosts the third night of the competition at his Saba Hotel in west London and finds his guests are expecting metropolitan chic, and certainly not fish and chips for dinner. Candida Leaver is extremely displeased when she experiences a sleepless night, while Sue Perkins and Gill take the opportunity to go out and have some fun.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Candida Leaver and Peter Starling, owners of the Bower Inn in Bridgwater, Somerset, play host in the last round of the week. The group activity is willow-weaving, and at dinner time the guests reveal what they think of their no-nonsense hosts.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants meet one last time to learn how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers before discovering who has won the week's competition. Old tensions resurface as the results are announced, and there are heated exchanges around the table.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Newly married couple Ed and Clare are planning to start a family soon and will need a larger home. Ed wants to raise his family where he grew up in Lunigiana, Italy, so Jonnie Irwin finds some rural properties within their £250,000 budget. However, Clare wants to remain close to her relatives, so asks Laura Hamilton to find them suitable properties in the Sevenoaks area of Kent.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: The property experts help new grandparents Geoff and Barbara Harrison choose a second home to enjoy with their growing family in Devon or in Languedoc, France.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Blythburgh, Suffolk: Skeletons in the Shed.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team investigate a back garden in Blythburgh, Suffolk, where a cupboard full of human skulls was discovered in the potting shed. The archaeologists believe the site could yield the remains of a medieval priory and the body of a Saxon warrior king killed on the nearby marshes. However, the buildings fail to materialise and burials are uncovered in strange locations.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Portskewett, South Wales: Hunting King Harold.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team investigate Harold's Field near Portskewett in south Wales, where local legends state that Harold II had a hunting lodge built in 1065. However, as the archaeologists search the previously uninvestigated site, they discover the Saxons were not alone in their interest in the location.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend head over to Denmark, where they embark on their first continental car rescue with a 1968 Volvo Amazon that has been in the same family for more than 45 years.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A Staffordshire bull terrier requires attention when it suffers complete paralysis in its back legs, and a Devon rex cat is brought in after being struck by a car. Its eight-year-old owner faces a tough decision when X-rays reveal a severely broken pelvis and a ruptured bladder. Plus, a young cavalier king has had seven operations in a bid to fix its knee joint, and Noel tries to resolve the problem.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows former blacksmith Alan Dawson, who has devised a way of building that should allow him to complete his home in just seven days. The method resembles that of a giant toy construction, with wiring, lighting, plumbing and carpets built into sections that are then taken to the site by lorry - but precision is critical if the house is to fit together.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: PC Greg Greaves calls for back-up in Crewe after two suspects shout claims of abuse and racism at him, and in Warrington, paramedic Becki arrives at the home of Marika, a Latvian woman who has been mugged in the street and left with a black eye. Meanwhile, PC Niaz Waddington and his colleagues keep a close eye on Saturday night revellers as the number of racially aggravated incidents dealt with by Cheshire Police on a typical weekend has doubled in the past five years.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Consultant Emer Sutherland helps treat an eight-year-old who has fallen 8ft onto concrete while riding his BMX, losing his front teeth and possibly injuring his head and spine. A 19-year-old motorcyclist who hit a bollard requires urgent treatment on his leg, which may otherwise need to be amputated, and X-rays of a stabbing victim yield startling results.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Return of the documentary that follows the work of Bedfordshire Police around the clock as they investigate a number of major crimes. In the first edition, a man emerges from a hotel lift covered in blood and holding a fire extinguisher, before approaching the reception desk and shouting that he has killed someone. Cameras follow every twist and turn as detectives try to work out what really happened at the hotel close to Luton Airport, which has suddenly become a chaotic and bloody crime scene.(n)

programme.desc: Joey's Funny Valentine. Joey's comedienne girlfriend (Felicia Michaels) incorporates jokes about the family into her routine. Joey: Dave Coulier. Danny: Bob Saget. Michelle: Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen. Jesse: John Stamos. D.J.: Candace Cameron(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: The Last Dance. Michelle gets a life lesson when her beloved great-grandfather (Jack Kruschen) dies while visiting. Michelle: Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen. Jesse: John Stamos. Danny: Bob Saget(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Kissing Cousins. Series regular John Stamos essays a dual role as Jesse Katsopolis and Jesse's lookalike Greek cousin Stavros. Invited to stay at the Tanner household, Stavros quickly reveals himself as a duplicitious con artist. The rest of the family sees through Stavros immediately, but agree to put up with him for Jesse's sake--until Stavros literally overplays his hand with Jesse's wife Becky (Lisa Loughlin . (Trivia note: David Dean doubles for John Stamos in the scenes where the cousins appear together)(n)

programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Love on the Rocks. While Steve's away, D.J. realizes it may be time to broaden her horizons. Suzanne Somers has a cameo. Steve: Scott Weinger. Keanu: Brian Evans. Kimmy: Andrea Barber(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One Where Ross Is Fine
programme.desc: The One Where Ross Is Fine. Ross invites Joey, Rachel and Charlie over for dinner; an uncomfortable experience that gets even worse when Ross drinks too much wine. Meanwhile, Phoebe's brother (Giovanni Ribisi) confesses that he can't cope with the triplets, and Chandler puts his foot in it big style when he and Monica visit a couple who have adopted a son(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The One with Ross's Tan. Ross goes to a tanning salon but fails to follow the "simple" instructions. Meanwhile, Rachel and Joey struggle to make the transition from friends to lovers(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The One with the Cake. Rachel convinces Monica and Chandler to delay their long-awaited holiday to join the rest of the friends at baby Emma's first birthday party, but problems ensue when Emma falls asleep and a racy cake turns up…(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The One with Ross's Grant. Ross discovers that his palaeontology grant application has to be approved by Dr Hobart (Greg Kinnear), who used to go out with Ross's girlfriend Charlie (Aisha Tyler). Meanwhile, Mike wants Phoebe to get rid of one of her bizarre paintings, but neither Rachel nor Monica is keen to take it. And Chandler lies to Joey about watching his audition tape(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Three's a Crowd. Hoping to "bond' with his cousin Will (Will Smith), Carlton (Alfonso Ribeiro) invites him for a weekend skiing trip. The plan fails miserably when the twosome suddenly becomes a threesome, thanks to the unexpected appearance of Will's sweetheart Lisa (Nia Long). And after several false starts, Hilary (Karyn Parsons) is finally prepared to move out of the Banks house and into her own place(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: It's A Wonderful Lie. A web of deceit surrounds a college party that Will attends---and where Ashley is found with a football player(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air

programme.sub-title: George Gets Caught in a Powers Play

programme.title: Live 2017 FIFA Confederations Cup
programme.sub-title: FIFA Confederations Cup Live: Russia v Portugal.
programme.desc: Russia v Portugal (Kick-off 4.00pm). Peter Collins presents coverage of both teams' second Group A encounter, held at Spartak Stadium in Moscow, Russia. The last time these sides met was in a 2015 friendly, when Russia won 1-0 in Kuban, courtesy of Roman Shirokov's late winner. However, the Portuguese were without the considerable presence of Cristiano Ronaldo on that occasion, and the Real Madrid star will be looking to make an impact on this tournament following a highly successful club campaign. With analysis from Damien Duff, Richie Sadlier and Didi Hamann, and commentary by Stephen Alkin and Jim Beglin.(n)

programme.title: Live 2017 FIFA Confederations Cup
programme.sub-title: FIFA Confederations Cup Live: Mexico v New Zealand.
programme.desc: Mexico v New Zealand (Kick-off 7.00pm). Peter Collins presents coverage of both teams' second Group A encounter, held at Fisht Olympic Stadium in Sochi, Russia. Mexico won this competition on home soil in 1999 and were also semi-finalists in 1995 and 2005, though they failed to reach the knockout rounds when the tournament was last held four years ago. New Zealand have taken part on three occasions, most recently in 2009, but are yet to progress beyond the group stage. With analysis from Damien Duff, Richie Sadlier and Didi Hamann, and commentary by George Hamilton and Ray Houghton.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: A man wrecks a jewellery store and puts a security guard in hospital. Murtaugh delves deep into the psyche of the suspect, a former Navy Seal once treated for post traumatic stress disorder, and draws parallels between him and his partner Riggs, who also once served in the military. Although Riggs' association with the suspect threatens to interfere with the case, it also forces him to open up to his colleague about the experiences that have shaped him. Clayne Crawford, Damon Wayans and Dante Brown star.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Weapon
programme.desc: Riggs and Murtaugh investigate a high-profile case surrounding the murder of a young model, and soon uncover a vicious secret behind the locked mansion gates of one of LA's wealthiest families. Riggs gets a jolt from his past when he discovers that an old friend of his wife has ties to the case. Back home, Murtaugh is shocked to hear that his daughter is sending revealing photos to her new boyfriend. Action drama, based on the popular, big-screen movies, starring Clayne Crawford and Damon Wayans.(n)

programme.title: Live 2017 FIFA Confederations Cup
programme.sub-title: FIFA Confederations Cup Live: Cameroon v Australia.
programme.desc: Cameroon v Australia (Kick-off 4.00pm). Darragh Maloney presents coverage of both teams' second Group B encounter, held at Saint Petersburg Stadium in Russia. These sides have never previously faced each other, and both nations will be determined to come out of this match with a victory given the strength of the two other sides in the group, Germany and Chile. With analysis from Brian Kerr, Didi Hamann and Richie Sadlier, and commentary by Stephen Alkin and Jim Beglin.(n)

programme.title: Live 2017 FIFA Confederations Cup
programme.sub-title: FIFA Confederations Cup Live: Germany v Chile.
programme.desc: Germany v Chile (Kick-off 7.00pm). Darragh Maloney presents coverage of both teams' second Group B encounter, held at Kazan Arena in Russia, as the world champions take on the reigning Copa America title-holders. The sides last met in a friendly in March 2014, when Germany's Mario Goetze scored the only goal of the game, just as he did in that year's World Cup final against Argentina. However, such is the strength-in-depth that Joachim Loew's men possess, Goetze is unlikely to make the squad this time around. With analysis from Brian Kerr, Didi Hamann and Richie Sadlier, and commentary by George Hamilton and Ray Houghton.(n)

programme.desc: Nick Knowles and the team come to the aid of a couple in Halifax, West Yorkshire, whose eight-year-old son is paralysed and can only access two rooms in their house. The family home is in need of a major overhaul but with only nine days to complete the job, the gang needs help - and that's where local tradesmen and other members of the community come in, turning up in force to bring designer Gabrielle Blackman's ideas to life.(n)

programme.title: Embarrassing Fat Bodies
programme.desc: Dr Christian Jessen meets a woman whose excessive eating has left her with a huge growth on her leg that weighs the same as a small child. She is now so dangerously obese she is running out of options to save her life. Dr Pixie McKenna helps a woman who wheels around her kitchen on an office chair because her joints and circulation cannot take her 33st, while the pumped-up portable pod is taken to Glasgow to tackle its growing obesity problem and launch a campaign to get the nation off their bottoms. Dawn and a volunteer check in at University Hospital in Coventry, where they are locked away for a 24-hour experiment in which all her bodily functions are monitored to find out how fat works and its effect on the human body.(n)

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Miami Mega Jail
programme.desc: Part one of two. The contemplative reporter examines life in Miami County Jail, where most of the inmates are awaiting trial. He begins by exploring the large cage-like dwellings on the fifth and sixth floors, which are home to many of the most volatile prisoners. The inmates' lives are governed by a gladiatorial code, leading to fights for food and status - a situation the guards say they are powerless to address.(n)

Drama, guest starring Barkhad Abdi (Captain Phillips).(n)

programme.desc: Phil comes across footage of an incriminating sneeze while looking at Cameron and Mitchell's wedding video that proves he is responsible for the family's flu epidemic, so he sets about getting rid of the proof with the help of Luke and some creative editing. Claire struggles to make it through an important business meeting while feeling under the weather, while Cam is forced to make a difficult decision when it comes to Manny and the school football team. Mitch meets Lily's know-it-all friend and male nanny Andy (Andy DeVine) makes a welcome return.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys move into a hotel while their house is being treated for mould, but when they are forced to share a single room, cabin fever soon sets in. programme.desc: The team welcomes the assistance of California special agent Kathy Milford (CSI: NY regular Melina Kanakaredes) as they set about tracking down an arsonist targeting couples. Meanwhile, Danno takes Amber on a romantic getaway, but things don't go quite to plan when her abusive ex-husband catches up with them.(n)

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A retired policeman is killed in a diamond robbery, and the vengeful team soon picks up a clue as one of the culprits has left behind a trail of blood. However, rather than make an immediate arrest, McGarrett and Danno stake out the robber's girlfriend, who was also involved in the crime, hoping to pick up both of them at the same time - and as the hours pass, it becomes clear the colleagues have a few issues to resolve. US crime drama, starring Alex O'Loughlin and Scott Caan. Directed by series star Daniel Dae Kim, who plays Chin Ho.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen and the team are assigned to protection detail for a conference attended by the heads of multiple navies, but find themselves searching for a possible North Korean spy.(n)

programme.title: Stargate Atlantis
programme.desc: Teyla is haunted by recurring nightmares, which lead her to discover she is a descendant of one of several humans who were subjected to genetic experiments by the Wraith many centuries ago.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: The Dunphys are sent into a panic when a loud, obnoxious couple come to look at the house next door. Jay is furious to learn that Manny is dating the granddaughter of his biggest business rival, while Mitch and Cam take on Lily's tyrannical teacher, Mrs Plank. Steve Zahn and Andrea Anders join the cast as new neighbours Ronnie and Amber, with guest star Tyne Daly.(n)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Halloween is Claire's favourite holiday, but this year she is snowed under at work, so she allows Phil to take over the house-decorating duties - a decision she soon comes to regret. programme.desc: Tired of feeling like an outcast, Leela has a second eye grafted on to her face. Meanwhile, Bender tries to get rich quickly by adopting 12 children - an act that entitles him to a government handout. Animated sci-fi comedy, with the voices of Billy West and Katey Sagal.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Bart Wants What It Wants.

programme.sub-title: The Lastest Gun in the West.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer manages to ruin any chance of building a friendship with his new neighbour, while Marge is concerned about the lack of friends Lisa has, and comes up with a plan to pay one of her classmates to pretend that they have the same interests as her daughter. However, things do not end as planned.(n)

programme.desc: Karl Pilkington travels the world in search of answers to some of life's most important questions. He begins with marriage, wondering whether he is wrong about not wanting to tie the knot with his long-term girlfriend. In Delhi, he gains an insight into arranged marriages by going on a date with a prospective wife - and her parents - and in Bangalore, he is asked to help a pair of elite wedding planners. He also sniffs out a scientific approach to finding the perfect partner in LA, before searching for an alternative way of getting hitched in Las Vegas.(n)

Joe finally decides to visit Henry in prison, only to let emotions get the better of him after Kyle shows up seeking revenge for his earlier arrest. Sci-fi drama, starring Grant Gustin and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: Arrow
programme.desc: Detective Lance's past catches up with him when he discovers a killer he put behind bars years ago has escaped from prison, and has continued his evil trade of torturing and murdering women. As if that weren't bad enough, his latest target is a little too close to home for comfort. Meanwhile, Oliver is shocked that the district attorney is seeking the death penalty for his mother.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross Kemp visits the Central American republic of Honduras, where he makes his way to the city of San Pedro Sula. With a rate of 169 homicides per 100,000 inhabitants last year - an average of more than three people each day - Sula has the dubious distinction of being the most dangerous city on the planet outside of a war zone. Ross discovers how armed drug gangs have taken over many parts of the country, forcing thousands to flee north on a freight train that transports migrants through Guatemala and across Mexico into the United States. But it's an arduous journey and not for the faint-hearted. Even if passengers avoid falling off the roof of the train to their deaths, they face being robbed by bandits, raped, murdered or kidnapped and sold into slavery.(n)

programme.title: The Blacklist
programme.desc: Red's allegiance to the FBI is tested when he is reunited with a high-ranking Chinese spy who previously hired him to decode a classified CIA transmission. Meanwhile, spending time in shady company is starting to rub off on Liz as she secretly investigates her husband's past. Crime drama, starring James Spader and Megan Boone.(n)

programme.title: Arrow

Unfortunately, the Mayor crashes the event with his gang, seriously injuring Sin - and when the Canary finds out her friend is in hospital, she sets out for revenge. Meanwhile, Felicity has some stunning information for Oliver, Donner asks Laurel to dinner, and Diggle reconnects with an old friend.(n)

programme.title: MacGyver

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: The former diplomat investigates how Moscow has changed since the break-up of the USSR and meets some of the city's most influential residents, including fashion designer Masha Tsigal and billionaire retail magnate Mikhail Kusnirovich. He also discovers the lingering influence of the KGB and talks to former secret service agent Anatoly Ermolin.(n)

programme.title: Networks of Power with Sir Christopher Meyer
programme.desc: The former British ambassador to the USA presents a guide to the forces that drive New York City, and examines the importance of money, faith and fashion in the Big Apple. He also meets several of the city's luminaries, including broadcaster Barbara Walters, mayor Michael Bloomberg, hedge fund manager Richard Hurowitz and Bruce Upbin, managing editor of business journal Forbes Magazine.(n)

programme.title: Fish Town
programme.desc: August arrives and the fishermen of Brixham spend time ashore with their families as their boats are repaired - but summer proves costly for Jan, who loses £1,000 for every day his vessel is out of action. Apprentice deckhand Logan has to decide whether a life at sea is the right choice for him and his family, and seafood seller Jenny receives a surprise on her 65th birthday.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Documentary following stately home owners who hire out their estates to earn extra income, and the clients who pay to use their properties for functions including stag parties, weddings and hunting trips. The programme explores how the reality of life in Britain's grand houses is often less glamorous than it appears, as proprietors struggle to maintain crumbling buildings and pay utility bills, and examines the modern-day divide between domestic staff and their employers. Featuring life at Chillingham Castle, Maunsel House, Carlton Towers and Muncaster Castle.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Clips from the hit drama are interspersed with interviews with former occupants of the real West Wing, including Presidents Ford, Carter and Clinton.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Part one of two. President Bartlet gives a speech in Indiana as his re-election campaign gets under way - but as the motorcade containing CJ and other staffers hits the road, Josh, Toby and Donna are left behind, forcing the trio to make their own way back to Washington DC. Meanwhile, Abbey's views on motherhood land her in trouble. Political drama, starring Martin Sheen, Rob Lowe, Richard Schiff and Stockard Channing.(n)

programme.title: Without a Trace
programme.desc: The team is called in to locate a pregnant woman who has absconded from hospital in a desperate bid to escape her violent husband, but its task is made doubly urgent by the revelation that she is suffering from a potentially fatal illness.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
programme.desc: Nick investigates the death of an accountant, and finds a connection to his own kidnapping ordeal. The team delves into the complex private life of a murder victim's girlfriend, revealing that her ex-boyfriend and mother may have had reasons for wanting her lover dead.(n)

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: As Frank contends with a whistleblower within the NYPD, Danny and Baez investigate a suspicious case originally written off as an accident.(n)

programme.title: Urban Secrets
programme.desc: Alan Cumming visits Liverpool, cutting through cliches about football and the Beatles to explore its less-celebrated treasures. Among his destinations are a 1930s banking building that has remained unaltered since closing in 2007, a well-appointed set of toilets and a recording studio hidden in a bar. He also discovers which former dictator once spent Christmas in the city.(n)

programme.title: The West Wing
programme.desc: Part two of two. As they continue their trek homeward from Unionville, Donna teaches Toby and Josh an important lesson, while back at the White House Bartlet hires a secretary. programme.desc: Qumar implicates Israel in the assassination, forcing President Bartlet to seek help from a legal team, Josh is unhappy to discover Amy has a job interview and Debbie is shocked when a comment she made years ago comes back to haunt her during a security check.
