programme.title: My Blind Brother
programme.desc: A slacker named Bill lives in the shadow of his more-successful brother Robbie, a blind athlete and local celebrity. When the pair both fall for the same woman, Bill is forced to compete against his arrogant, narcissistic sibling for the first time(n)

programme.title: Sleeping with the Enemy
programme.desc: Laura Burney seems to have the perfect life: a stunning house and a loving husband, Martin. Except he is a psycopath who savagely beats her if a bathroom towel is wrongly folded. Fearing for her life, she fakes her death by drowning and flees to a small town in Iowa to begin a new life, which includes being courted by her neighbour Ben Woodward. But Martin slowly realises her ruse and begins to track her down and, if he finds her, she really will be dead..(n)

programme.title: Obsessed
programme.desc: Golden Globe nominated superstar, Beyoncé, stars in this seductive thriller. A successful asset manager, who has just received a Movie:huge promotion, is blissfully happy in his career and in his marriage. But when a temp worker starts stalking him, all the things he's worked so hard for are placed in jeopardy. Starring Beyoncé Knowles & Idris Elba(n)

programme.title: Quarantine
programme.desc: In the frightmarish tradition of "The Blair Witch Project" comes this nerve-jangling chiller. Jennifer Carpenter is outstanding as a TV reporter who gets confined to a quarantined apartment complex in Los Angeles that houses a mysterious, scary secret. It isn't long before she learns why someone was "screaming bloody murder." A remake of the 2007 Spanish horror film "REC." Directed by John Erick Dowdle, who cowrote the script with Drew Dowdle. Steve Harris, Jay Hernandez, Johnathon Schaech(n)

programme.title: The Thomas Crown Affair
programme.desc: Thriller about a millionaire with a thirst for danger who steals a priceless painting for the sake of a challenge and seduces the woman charged with investigating his crime. Despite warnings from her colleagues about his charm, she and the thief become dangerously close as he approaches his most audacious robbery yet(n)

programme.title: The Lady in the Van
programme.desc: A homeless woman parks her van in the driveway of playwright Alan Bennett's house and lives there for 15 years. Over the course of her stay, the two form a unique friendship(n)

programme.title: Miles Ahead
programme.desc: This free-form biopic of jazz musician Miles Davis depicts his attempts at a career comeback following a period of listlessness in the '70s, his relationship with a journalist who wants to profile him and his troubled marriage to a former dancer(n)

programme.title: Glory
programme.desc: War drama starring Matthew Broderick and Denzel Washington, and adapted from letters sent by Colonel Robert G Shaw, an officer in the Federal Army during the American Civil War. Shaw volunteered to lead the first company of black soldiers, and had to face the bigotry of both the army's enemies and of his fellow officers(n)

programme.title: The Meddler
programme.desc: After the death of her husband, a woman named Marnie relocates to Los Angeles to be closer to her daughter Lori, a Hollywood screenwriter. While Lori frets about her mother's smothering ways, Marnie keeps getting involved in the lives of others: She dates an ex-cop, helps an Apple Store employee study for school and pays for a lesbian wedding(n)

programme.title: Army of One
programme.desc: An ex-con receives a message from God that he must head to Pakistan and bring Osama bin Laden to justice. However, his bizarre journey draws the attention of US forces stationed in the Middle East, who are baffled and annoyed by his vigilante quest(n)

programme.desc: Bill Murray is the cynical weatherman forced to repeat the same day over and over again. Is romancing Andie MacDowell the key to living the day right?(n)

programme.title: Groundhog Day
programme.desc: Bill Murray is the cynical weatherman forced to repeat the same day over and over again. Is romancing Andie MacDowell the key to living the day right?(n)

programme.title: The Family Stone
programme.desc: The normally laid-back Stone family are shocked when golden child Everett brings his uptight, bigoted fiancee Meredith home to meet them for Christmas(n)

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
programme.desc: In Quentin Tarantino's homage to Asian action movies and spaghetti Westerns, Uma Thurman stars as an assassin who seeks revenge on those who left her for dead on her wedding day(n)

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
programme.desc: Vengeful assassin The Bride killed two of her enemies in Vol. One. Now she's out to settle old scores with three more adversaries: Elle, Budd and Bill, the man she once loved. Thriller(n)

programme.title: Equity
programme.desc: A senior investment banker (Anna Gunn) tries to prove her worth to her firm by bringing in a tech company that's on the verge of going public. However, the IPO causes her to get tangled up in an investigation into securities fraud. James Purefoy, Alysia Reiner, Craig Bierko, and Sarah Megan Thomas co-star. Directed by Meera Menon, Equity made its world premiere at the 2016 Sundance Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Freaks of Nature
programme.desc: A town full of humans, zombies, and vampires living in co-existence are thrust into an all-out war when aliens invade. Now, three teenagers must defeat the newest visitors to restore the peace(n)

programme.title: American Gods
programme.desc: Come to Jesus. As war approaches, Mr. Wednesday needs to recruit one more Old God: Ostara, aka Easter, Goddess of the Dawn, but swaying her requires making a good impression, so Mr. Nancy is brought in(n)

programme.title: Deep Impact
programme.desc: This action blockbuster sees the Earth facing destruction from a two billion tonne asteroid on a collision course. When Jenny Lerner believes she has uncovered a sex scandal in the White House, she does not suspect that the truth of the matter is far more terrifying. A comet the size of Mount Everest is headed towards Earth and, if it hits, all life on the face of the Earth will be obliterated. The planet's only hope lies with a team of young astronauts, led by a veteran of moon landings, dispatched into space to save the day with a rocket full of nuclear weapons(n)

programme.title: American Gods
programme.desc: Come to Jesus. As war approaches, Mr. Wednesday needs to recruit one more Old God: Ostara, aka Easter, Goddess of the Dawn, but swaying her requires making a good impression, so Mr. Nancy is brought in(n)

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
programme.desc: In Quentin Tarantino's homage to Asian action movies and spaghetti Westerns, Uma Thurman stars as an assassin who seeks revenge on those who left her for dead on her wedding day(n)

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
programme.desc: Vengeful assassin The Bride killed two of her enemies in Vol. One. Now she's out to settle old scores with three more adversaries: Elle, Budd and Bill, the man she once loved. Thriller(n)

programme.title: Waking Life
programme.desc: From director Richard Linklater, who created the independent breakout films Slacker and Dazed and Confused, comes a digital video effort that has animated in a process called interpolated rotoscoping, brought to life by 31 animation artists who drew over live-action footage to create a dream-like state that is both real and surreal. The director works in a free-associative manner much like in Slacker and opens on a young vagabond arriving at a town by train. After a ride in an odd car-boat, he meets up with a professor who voices his deep philosophical leanings. The young man stumbles upon more figures that resemble the media, evolution, and even characters out of other Linklater features, including Ethan Hawke and Julie Delpy, whose characters in Before Sunrise make an appearance, as well as director Steven Soderbergh, who relates an anecdote about Louis Malle telling Billy Wilder that his new film "is like a dream." A non-narrative piece that flows like a fever dream, Waking Life features voicework by over 70 actors, including Wiley Wiggins, Adam Goldberg, and Nicky Katt(n)

programme.title: We Own the Night
programme.desc: Crime drama set in 1980s Brooklyn. A nightclub owner routinely turns a blind eye to the criminal activities under his roof, but when his NYPD father and brother ask him to help them gather intelligence on the Russian mafia, he finds himself torn between family loyalty and protecting himself from the most ruthless criminals in New York City(n)

programme.title: What's Eating Gilbert Grape
programme.desc: A withdrawn young man in a small rural town grows bored with his life, which consists of a meaningless job and the tiresome task of caring for his mentally handicapped brother. The arrival of a new girl in town, however, brings unexpected changes for everyone in this quirky drama(n)

programme.title: Glengarry Glen Ross
programme.desc: A group of real-estate agents resort to desperate measures when they are forced to participate in a vicious sales competition in which only the top two earners will be allowed to keep their jobs(n)

programme.title: Muriel's Wedding
programme.desc: Comic tale of a warm but klutzy woman who worships ABBA and is determined to have the wedding of her dreams(n)

programme.title: Eat That Question: Frank Zappa in His Own Words
programme.desc: Exploring the life and career of avant-garde musician Frank Zappa entirely via archival footage of the man, including interviews and concert performances(n)

programme.title: Being John Malkovich
programme.desc: Craig Schwartz is a puppeteer at the end of his string, who takes a job as an office assistant and discovers a small boarded-up door which leads directly into the head of John Malkovich(n)

programme.title: Postcards from the Edge
programme.desc: Substance-addicted Hollywood actress Suzanne Vale, after a spell at a detox centre, must live with her mother Doris Mann as a condition of her film company continuing to employ her. However Doris who was once a star is now a champion drinker(n)

programme.title: Aloft
programme.desc: In this mystical and nonlinear drama, a mother (Jennifer Connelly) reunites with her estranged son (Cillian Murphy), whom she abandoned two decades earlier after a strange encounter with a faith healer(n)

programme.title: What's Eating Gilbert Grape
programme.desc: A withdrawn young man in a small rural town grows bored with his life, which consists of a meaningless job and the tiresome task of caring for his mentally handicapped brother. The arrival of a new girl in town, however, brings unexpected changes for everyone in this quirky drama(n)

programme.title: In Bruges
programme.desc: Hitmen Colin Farrell and Brendan Gleeson hide out in Bruges after a job goes terribly wrong. Will gangster boss Ralph Fiennes forgive them?(n)

programme.title: Being John Malkovich
programme.desc: Craig Schwartz is a puppeteer at the end of his string, who takes a job as an office assistant and discovers a small boarded-up door which leads directly into the head of John Malkovich(n)

programme.title: Dr. Strangelove Or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb
programme.desc: Through a series of military and political accidents, two psychotic US Generals trigger an ingenious, foolproof and irrevocable scheme which would unleash a wing of B-52 H-Bombers to attack strategic targets in Russia. The brains behind the "trigger" belong to Dr Strangelove, a wheelchair bound nuclear scientist with bizzare ideas about man's future(n)

programme.title: Kung Fu Hustle
programme.desc: The work of international superstar Stephen Chow, Kung Fu Hustle is a humorous, special-effects-filled, action-packed martial arts epic set in early '40s China. A bumbling thief named Sing (Stephen Chow) desires to be the toughest member of the dreaded gangster hit squad known as The Axe Gang, but to completely join the gang he has to commit murder. When Sing attempts to rob a crowded run-down apartment complex known as Pig Sty Alley, the locals begin to defend themselves with some high-flying kung fu skills, and a tiny war erupts between the local masters and the axe-wielding gang. After the gang busts the ancient kung fu king known as The Beast (Leung Siu Lung) out of jail, tensions reach a boiling point as Pig Sty Alley's landlady (Yuen Qiu) leads an all-out attack against the gang and Sing discovers his true heroic fate. Kung Fu Hustle, which set box-office records across Asia during its December 2004 release, also stars Yuen Wah and Xing Yu, and features fight choreography by legendary masters of martial arts cinema Yuen Woo Ping and Sammo Hung(n)

programme.title: Pi
programme.desc: In this award-winning intellectual thriller, a math genius (Sean Gullette) develops a dangerous obsession with an elusive 216-number sequence. He is pursued by corporate agents who are also after the number, which is tied to the stock market. Mark Margolis, Ben Shenkman. Written and directed by Darren Aronofsky(n)

programme.title: Spread
programme.desc: A ¿serial-womanizer¿, Nikki (Ashton Kutcher) moves from one wealthy woman to another and operates by his own set of rules. He¿s also homeless, car-less, amoral, and good-looking. His latest conquest is Samantha (Anne Heche), an attorney whose house overlooks L.A. But in Nikki's world of money, power, and fame, true stardom is fleeting, since he¿s beginning to develop actual feelings for a pretty young waitress. Little does he know that he's about to fall victim to his own seductive game(n)

programme.title: Clerks
programme.desc: Acclaimed, low-budget comedy following a day in the life of a pair of New Jersey shop workers. On his day off, Dante is forced to open the convenience store where he works. His laid-back friend works in the video store next door - if he can be bothered - and together the pair discuss sex, girls, porn, and movie trivia, and also manage to fit in a wake and a rooftop hockey game in an effort to pass another day(n)

programme.title: Postcards from the Edge
programme.desc: Substance-addicted Hollywood actress Suzanne Vale, after a spell at a detox centre, must live with her mother Doris Mann as a condition of her film company continuing to employ her. However Doris who was once a star is now a champion drinker(n)

programme.title: Terms of Endearment
programme.desc: Multi-Oscar-winning melodrama revolving around the relationship between a clinging mother and her headstrong daughter. While widow Aurora fends off a stream of admirers, daughter Emma learns the hard facts of married life. She is stunned to find that her college professor husband is having an affair with one of his students, but a much greater shock lies in store after a routine visit to the doctor(n)

programme.title: The Weight of Water
programme.desc: A photographer travels to New Hampshire to investigate the double murder of two women in 1873. Discovering an eye witness account she starts to see parallels between herself and a survivor(n)

programme.title: Brooklyn's Finest
programme.desc: Training Day director Antoine Fuqua takes viewers on a dark ride through the streets of Brooklyn, following three New York Police officers as they wrestle with temptation, loyalty, and duty while attempting to uphold the law and deal with the pressures of the job. Eddie Dugan is days away from retirement, but he's been burnt-out for years. Unable to remember why he signed up for the job in the first place, all Eddie can think about is retreating to his fishing cabin in Connecticut, and forgetting the horrors that he's seen during his decades on the job. At the same time, undercover narcotics cop Clarence "Tango" Butler is right in the thick of it. As hard as he tries to quit, however, his superiors always find a way of keeping him on the job(n)

programme.title: Traitor
programme.desc: When straight arrow FBI agent Roy Clayton heads up the investigation into a dangerous international conspiracy, all clues seem to lead back to former U.S. Special Operations officer, Samir Horn(n)

programme.title: Imperium
programme.desc: An idealistic FBI agent (Daniel Radcliffe) goes deep undercover within a white-supremacy group in order to bring down the organization from the inside. Daniel Ragussis directed this crime thriller, which co-stars Toni Collette and Tracy Letts(n)
Fact-based account of a group of gifted university students who develop a system for card-counting and use it to win big at Las Vegas casinos(n)

programme.title: Pride and Prejudice and Zombies
programme.desc: Spunky martial artist Elizabeth Bennet and wealthy zombie killer Mr. Darcy fall in love despite their class differences while battling an undead uprising in 19th-century England(n)

programme.title: The Eagle Huntress
programme.desc: A 13-year-old Mongolian girl named Aisholpan Nurgaiv strives to become the first female in her culture to learn to hunt alongside a trained eagle. As she prepares for an annual eagle-hunting competition, she must also deal with the disapproval of several tribal elders. Directed by Otto Bell(n)

programme.title: Head over Heels
programme.desc: Monica Potter and Freddie Prinze Jr. costar in this amiable comedy. Potter plays a lovelorn art restorer who develops a crush on a fashion consultant (Prinze). She thinks he's a dreamboat---until she sees something that makes her suspect he's a killer. Shalom Harlow, Ivana Milicevic, Sarah O'Hare(n)

programme.title: Summer Rental
programme.desc: After air traffic controller Jack Chester loses a plane, he's told to take a break. Booking his family into a plush resort, however, his much-needed vacation soon turns into a total disaster(n)

programme.title: Beer for My Horses
programme.desc: Bill Racklin is a deputy sheriff in Greer County Oklahoma, the crystal meth capital of the region. His girlfriend leaves him, but things look up when his high-school sweetheart, Annie, returns home. On a stakeout, Rack and two other deputies arrest four men stealing fertilizer to make crystal meth; one of the four is the brother of a notorious Mexican drug dealer. The drug lord arranges Annie's kidnapping and holds her to ransom his brother(n)

programme.title: The Perfect Holiday
programme.desc: All a young girl wants for Christmas is a husband for her divorced mother, so she dumps the problem into the lap of a department-store Santa, who decides to handle the matter personally(n)

programme.title: Say It Isn't So
programme.desc: Chris Klein stars in this raunchy romantic comedy as a lonely, orphaned animal-control specialist who thinks he's finally found the girl of his dreams, until it is revealed that they are actually brother and sister. Or are they?(n)

programme.title: The Rewrite
programme.desc: Cynical screenwriter takes a teaching job just to pay the bills, but gains a new perspective when he falls for mature student(n)

programme.title: Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story
programme.desc: Directed by Rawson Marshall Thurber, Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story revolves around amiable underachiever Peter LaFleur (Vince Vaughn), whose rundown gym, Average Joe's, is populated by a less-than-average clientele including a self-styled pirate, an ultra-obscure sports aficionado, and a pining high school nerd. It soon becomes apparent that Joe's is in financial trouble and will soon be foreclosed by attractive attorney Kate Veach (Christine Taylor) - unless Peter can cough up $50,000. Despite Average Joe's posing little threat to Globo Gym, a fitness Goliath across the street that is owned by egomaniacal White Goodman (Ben Stiller) - Goodman senses an easy acquisition and decides to take over the facility. Peter's ragtag group of regulars, however, are less than thrilled with the prospects, and mobilize a showdown, winner-takes-all Dodgeball tournament against Globo Gym. The film also features Missi Pyle, Rip Torn, Stephen Root, and Alan Tudyk(n)

programme.title: Nothing Like the Holidays
programme.desc: An injured soldier returns home to spend Christmas with his family after serving overseas, also hoping to track down his lost love. He finds his siblings have problems of their own to cope with, while his mother is planning to divorce his secretive father(n)

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop
programme.desc: An ordinary mall cop becomes a hero when he saves the day by stopping some goons from robbing the mall(n)

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: Arnold Schwarzenegger shows his lighter side in this jolly Yuletide comedy. He plays an overworked father who scrambles to find the perfect gift for his son on Christmas Eve. Desperate to make up for previous disappointments, he searches the city and battles frantic parents, a toy-crazed postal worker and a deviant Santa to find the elusive Turbo Man doll. Sinbad, Phil Hartman, Rita Wilson(n)

programme.title: The Perfect Holiday
programme.desc: All a young girl wants for Christmas is a husband for her divorced mother, so she dumps the problem into the lap of a department-store Santa, who decides to handle the matter personally(n)

programme.title: Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story
programme.desc: Directed by Rawson Marshall Thurber, Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story revolves around amiable underachiever Peter LaFleur (Vince Vaughn), whose rundown gym, Average Joe's, is populated by a less-than-average clientele including a self-styled pirate, an ultra-obscure sports aficionado, and a pining high school nerd. It soon becomes apparent that Joe's is in financial trouble and will soon be foreclosed by attractive attorney Kate Veach (Christine Taylor) - unless Peter can cough up $50,000. Despite Average Joe's posing little threat to Globo Gym, a fitness Goliath across the street that is owned by egomaniacal White Goodman (Ben Stiller) - Goodman senses an easy acquisition and decides to take over the facility. programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
programme.desc: Craig Phillips, winner of Channel 4's Big Brother, introduces the first of his two favourite films. One of the most successful British films of all time, Mike Newell's now-classic 'feel-good' movie stars Hugh Grant and Andie McDowell as the couple who seem made for each other but seem intent on staying apart. Their central performances are brilliantly supported by Kristin Scott Thomas, James Fleet and Simon Callow(n)

programme.title: Chasing Amy
programme.desc: Intelligent comedy from indie film-maker Kevin Smith of Clerks fame, starring Ben Affleck as Holden, a maker of comic books who thinks he has found the love of his life, Alyssa, until he discovers she is gay. Razor sharp dialogue keeps this film moving as Holden first attempts to come to terms with the impossibility of his love and then realises that he cannot change his feelings, even if they can never be returned(n)

programme.title: To Rome With Love
programme.desc: Four sets of strangers experience life, love, fortune and fame in the Italian capital(n)

programme.title: Sweet Home Alabama
programme.desc: After establishing herself as a bankable star with the fish out of water comedy Legally Blonde, Reese Witherspoon returns in what could be described as a "fish back in water" comedy. Melanie Carmichael (Witherspoon) is a successful New York fashion designer who is dating Andrew Hennings (Patrick Dempsey), a wealthy socialite whose mother, Katherine Hennings (Candice Bergen), is the Big Apple's mayor. One day, Andrew pops the big question and asks Melanie to marry him; Melanie is overjoyed, but unknown to Andrew, Melanie has some unfinished business to take care of first. Despite her polished uptown image, Melanie grew up poor in the deep South, and as a teenager she married her high school sweetheart Jake Perry (Josh Lucas). Things went sour and Melanie moved East, reinventing herself along the way, but Jake never bothered to legally end their marriage. Now Melanie has to return to her hometown of Pigeon Creek, AL, to tell her parents (Fred Ward and Mary Kay Place) the news and convince Jake to grant her a divorce; however, the more time she spends with her old flame, the more she feels sparks flying between them again, while she also learns her Eastern affectations don't fly with everyone back home(n)

programme.title: Bowfinger
programme.desc: Hollywood, today: Bobby Bowfinger, a run-down actor-producer-director, is reading a script, which a friend has written. Completely convinced of its quality, he decides to take a last shot at fame and fortune. But the script is not that easy to sell, and a famous producer promises him to do it, but there is one condition: Kit Ramsey, Hollywood's number one star, has to be in it. So, Bobby tries his luck with Kit - who says no - and then decides to shoot the film himself. Together with the cheapest team available in Southern California, with an aspiring beauty from Ohio, with a diva, who is just a little over the hill, with a key-holding gofer from a major studio, and with a goon hired away from burger-flipping, Bobby sets out to shoot the science-fiction-film starring Kit Ramsey - who does not know a bit(n)

programme.title: Not Easily Broken
programme.desc: The Johnson's ten year marriage is under strain, estate agent Clarice is focusing on her career while husband Dave longs for a family. When Clarice is injured in a car crash, her mother drives a wedge between the couple and Dave spends time with Clarice's kind-hearted physiotherapist. But can their faith bring them back together? Drama(n)

programme.title: Cry, the Beloved Country
programme.desc: Alan Paton's classic novel about two fathers coming to terms with personal loss and the emotional scars inflicted on South Africa during the era of apartheid was brought to the screen for a second time with this adaptation, the first major film produced in South Africa after Nelson Mandela's election ended mandatory white rule in that nation. Rev. Stephen Kumalo (James Earl Jones) is a minister from a poverty-stricken farming community who travels to Johannesburg for the first time in search of his son Absalom (Eric Miyeni), who moved to the city some time back and has gone missing. Kumalo regards the big city as a den of iniquity, and his low expectations are not betrayed; he is robbed and beaten shortly after he arrives, and when he visits his brother John (Charles S. Dutton), he discovers that Absalom has become a petty thief with a pregnant girlfriend, his sister Gertrude (Dambisa Kente) is a prostitute, and John has renounced his faith in God and advocates the violent overthrow of South Africa's white leadership. James Jarvis (Richard Harris) -- a wealthy white landowner from the same part of the country as Kumalo -- has also arrived in Johannesburg, also with sad personal business to attend to; his son, a well-liked activist for the rights of the city's black majority population, was killed during a robbery(n)

programme.title: Righteous Kill
programme.desc: Jon Avnet's thriller Righteous Kill stars Al Pacino and Robert De Niro as a pair of Big Apple police officers investigating a series of murders committed by a serial killer. Carla Gugino co-stars as a crime-scene investigator who has romantic ties to De Niro. 50 Cent, Donnie Wahlberg, Brian Dennehy, and John Leguizamo co-star(n)

programme.title: American Gods
programme.desc: Come to Jesus. As war approaches, Mr. Wednesday needs to recruit one more Old God: Ostara, aka Easter, Goddess of the Dawn, but swaying her requires making a good impression, so Mr. Nancy is brought in(n)

programme.title: Ride With the Devil
programme.desc: A complex tale of uneasy alliances and hostilities along the Kansas/Missouri border during the Civil War, Ride with the Devil opens in 1862. The story concerns Jack Bull Chiles (Skeet Ulrich), a proud son of the South ready to fight for the Confederate cause after his father is killed by Yankee troops. Chiles's friend, Jake Roedel (Tobey Maguire), joins the Bushwhackers, a group of renegade Southerners aligned with the Confederate Army, even though his family supports the Union cause - which sets him head-to-head with his father. The two young men, used to the slow pace and gracious lifestyle of the South's privileged class, become guerilla fighters and wander through the countryside together, encountering sudden, shocking and extreme acts of violence. Their comrades include valiant leader Black John (James Caviezel), paranoid madman Pitt (Jonathan Rhys Myers), gentleman George (Simon Baker), and Daniel (Jeffrey Wright), a laconic former slave who unexpectedly fighs for the south despite his race out of sheer loyalty to George - though the others regard him with suspicion. The Bushwhackers hide out in a shed near the home of Sue Lee Shelley (singer/songwriter/poet Jewel), a pregnant widow whose husband was killed three weeks after their marriage. Later, following a shocking and unexpected act of violence, a number of the men team up with the crazed Quantrill (John Ales) to stage an attack on an abolitionist stronghold, but Jake finds his moral conscience growing more acute, and takes the first steps toward romancing and starting a family with Sue Lee in what looks to be a very different post-Civil War future. Adapted from the novel Woe to Live On by Daniel Woodrell, Ride with the Devil was directed by Ang Lee, whose previous project was a very different look at America's past, the 1970s domestic drama The Ice Storm (1997)(n)

programme.title: American Gods
programme.desc: Come to Jesus. As war approaches, Mr. Wednesday needs to recruit one more Old God: Ostara, aka Easter, Goddess of the Dawn, but swaying her requires making a good impression, so Mr. Nancy is brought in(n)

programme.desc: Two criminal drifters without sympathy get more than they bargained for after kidnapping and holding for ransom the surrogate mother of a powerful and shady man(n)

programme.title: Liberty's Kids
programme.desc: United We Stand. Sam and John Adams (voice of Billy Crystal) argue against Britain's "Intolerable Acts," and Sarah meets Abigail Adams (Annette Bening). Voice of Franklin: Walter Cronkite. Other voices include Reo Jones (Sarah), Chris Lundquist (James), D. Kevin Williams (Moses) and Kathleen Barr (Henri)(n)

programme.title: The Natural
programme.desc: The film version of The Natural pulls off the neat trick of conveying the spirit of the Bernard Malamud novel upon which it is based, even while changing both the outcome and the meaning of Malamud's closing chapters. In his first film appearance in four years, Robert Redford plays Roy Hobbs, a farm boy with a hankering to be a great baseball player. With his faithful homemade bat "Wonderboy" in hand, Roy heads to the big city. En route, he arouses the fascination of the mysterious Harriet Bird (Barbara Hershey). Luring the boy to a hotel room, Harriet asks Roy what he wants out of life. Roy brashly responds he wants to be "the best there is," whereupon Harriet whips out a gun and shoots Roy down. Sixteen years later, a humbler Roy Hobbs emerges from the bush leagues to become a 35-year-old "rookie" on the 1939 lineup of the New York Knights. He soon becomes the team's star player, and in so doing once more attracts enigmatic woman Memo Paris (Kim Basinger), the glamorous niece of the Knights' manager Pop Fisher (Wilford Brimley) and the mistress of Rothstein-like gambler Gus Sands (a curiously unbilled Darren McGavin). Roy's fascination with Memo compromises his ability to play, but this time he finds salvation in the form the angelic Iris Gaines (Glenn Close), his childhood sweetheart. From this point forward, the script for The Natural bears very little resemblance to the Malamud original. Without giving anything away, it can be said that Roy Hobbs is given a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to compensate for the mistakes of his youth, despite the demonic intrusion of inexplicably spiteful sports writer Max Mercy (Robert Duvall). The Natural elevates the art of slow-motion photography to new heights; while this technique would become precious and boring in later baseball films, it works beautifully here, as does the decision by director Barry Levinson and cinematographer Caleb Deschanel to convey the symbolism inherent in the story in purely visual rather than blatantly verbal terms. (If the characters told you that the story was a retelling of the Camelot legend in baseball terms, would you have watched?) Another plus is the pastoral theme music by Randy Newman, which has been well utilized on sports broadcasts and "human interest" TV documentaries ever since. The baseball scenes in The Natural were staged at War Memorial Stadium in Buffalo, New York(n)

programme.desc: A housewife in the middle of a divorce takes charge of her daughter's chaotic Wilderness Girls troop(n)

programme.title: Sydney White
programme.desc: After pledging her late mother's once-dignified sorority, a college freshman aligns herself with seven social outcasts in an attempt to influence change over the school's flawed social hierarchy in this comedy starring Amanda Bynes. College freshman Sydney White (Bynes) has just arrived at Southern Atlantic University ready and eager to pledge her late mother's sorority. Once upon a time, this sorority was dignified and respected, but that pristine reputation has been tarnished now that blonde tyrant Rachel (Sara Paxton) has taken over as student council president. After surviving the sorority's vigorous pledging process, Syd is quickly banished for daring to question Rachel's regime. Now left with nowhere to go but a condemned house on the edge of Greek Row, the dejected and rejected pledge quickly makes friends with seven of the biggest social outcasts on campus. But while these socially challenged frat boys may not be much to look at, it gradually becomes apparent to Syd that they all have their fair share of admirable qualities -- especially love-struck super-geek Tyler (Matt Long). Perhaps if these nerdy frat boys and their new queen could successfully shake up the system by staging a successful takeover of the student government, they could restore the once-proud reputation of this prestigious university and offer a glimmer of hope to campus geeks everywhere!(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Zone
programme.desc: The Silence. Fed up with the loud and incessant talking of fellow men's club member Jamie Tennyson (Liam Sullivan), pompous Col. Archie Taylor (Franchot Tone) decides to place a most unusual wager. With $500,000 at stake, Taylor bets that Tennyson cannot remain silent for a full year. Deeply in debt, Tennyson accepts the wager, and even permits himself to be placed in a glass cage in the club's basement, so that Taylor and the other members can monitor his silence. Though the story contains no science-fiction or fantasy trappings whatsover, the ironic ending is very much in keeping with the standards set by previous Twilight Zone episodes. First telecast April 28, 1961, "The Silence" was scripted by Rod Serling -- and though Serling denied it at the time, the story would seem to have been influenced by Anton Chekhov's "The Bet."(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: How Green Was My Apple. When an apple on the Bundys' tree is seen hanging over the D'Arcy's yard, a battle royal ensues between the two neighboring families. In fine Laurel and Hardy tradition, the hostilities begin with a few small volleys designed to embarrass but not injure. Before long, however, the tit-for-tat warfare gets out of hand, and the results are truly explosive. Highlights in this episode include a pointed reference to Ted Danson's recent embarrassing blackface turn, as well as cameo appearances by sitcom favorites Danny Bonaduce, Dave Madden and Gary Coleman (the latter going ballistic when someone mentions that he looks like himself!)(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: Valentine's Day Massacre. In this "Special Valentine's Sextravaganza" (to quote the original TV Guide ads, Kelly (Christina Applegate) belatedly remembers to hand over a Valentine's Day card sent to Bud (David Faustino) by someone named Rita. Though it's been several years since the card was posted, Bud is determined to respond to Rita in an appropriate (or even inappropriate) manner. Meanwhile, Al (Ed O'Neill) battles a huge crowd of forgetful husbands as he tries to purchase a gift for Peg at the very last minute(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: Get Outta Dodge. Just as he is prepared to sell his old Dodge, Al (Ed O'Neill) is approached by an auto executive who offers him a chance to appear in a commercial--with a bikini model by his side--in which the Bundy's car hits the One Million Mile mark. Now it is up to Al to keep both the car and himself alive for the occasion, lest he lose his opportunity to drive home in a brand-new Viper. Elsewhere, Kelly (Christina Applegate) doesn't quite understand that "Where's Waldo" is a game and not a lifelong quest. This episode was trimmed for syndication after September 11, 2001, to remove an ominous reference to sabotage at the Sears Tower(n)

Meanwhile, Al's daughter Kelly (Christina Applegate), in her professional guise as The Verminator, tests out the new "Springtime in Baghdad" pesticide on Bud (David Faustino) and Buck--with some fascinating side effects (among them an emormous pair of male breasts). Appearing as Sascha is future Buffy the Vampire Slayer regular Julie Benz(n)

programme.title: Married...With Children
programme.desc: The D'Arcy Files. In this spoof of The X-Files, a mysterious stranger (Robert Mandan) offers Al (Ed O'Neill) $50,000 to help him locate Jefferson D'Arcy (Ted McGinley)--not exactly a daunting assignment, since Jefferson has been living next door to Al for nearly two years. And the reason behind the Stranger's interest? Well, it might be that Jefferson was telling the truth to his wife Marcy (Amanda Bearse) when he claimed that he was once an espionage agent and master of disguise (Peter Lawford was one of his best "covers"!)(n)

programme.title: Seinfeld

Jerry Seinfeld, the actor, recounts the first 99 episodes of the show that featured the comedic adventures of Jerry Seinfeld, the character, and his friends George, Elaine, and Kramer. Highlight clips from the first five and a half seasons of the show fill this episode, which was originally the first half of a one-hour episode. "Highlights of a Hundred" was actually shot after all of the episodes for the show's sixth season had been taped, despite airing February 2, 1995, in the middle of the season.
